      </table>
    </div>
    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">

            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">the
                Company&#8217;s ability to successfully market its existing and new
                products,</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>

    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Readers
      are urged to carefully review and consider the various disclosures made by
      the
      Company in this Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended June 30, 2007,
      and
      the Company&#8217;s other filings with the SEC.&#160;&#160;These reports attempt to
      advise interested parties of the risks and factors that may affect the Company&#8217;s
      business, financial condition and results of operations and
      prospects.&#160;&#160;The forward - looking statements made in this Annual
      Report on Form 10-K speak only as of the date hereof and the Company disclaims
      any obligation to provide updates, revisions or amendments to any
      forward-looking statements to reflect changes in the Company&#8217;s expectations or
      future events.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">3</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><u>Part
      I</u></strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><u>Item
      1.&#160;&#160;Business</u></strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>a)
      General Development of Business</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">AFP
      Imaging Corporation was organized on September 20, 1978 under the laws of the
      State of New York.&#160;&#160;Since then, the Company has been engaged in the
      business of designing, developing, manufacturing and distributing equipment
      for
      generating and/or capturing medical and dental diagnostic images.&#160;&#160;The
      products utilize electronic and radiographic technologies, as well as the
      chemical processing of photosensitive materials.&#160;&#160;The Company is ISO
      9001 certified.&#160;&#160;Veterinary and industrial professionals also use the
      Company&#8217;s imaging products.&#160;&#160;The Company distributes in world-wide
      markets, under various brand names and trademarks, through a network of
      independent and unaffiliated dealers.&#160;&#160;Certain digital imaging
      products are also sold and distributed by the Company directly to dental
      professional end users, through a new distribution channel, acquired in fiscal
      year 2007.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company&#8217;s primary objective is to be a leading provider of cost effective,
      diagnostic radiographic products for applications in the medical, dental,
      veterinary and industrial imaging fields.&#160;&#160;The Company is
      concentrating on:</font></div>
    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 36pt">
              <div>&#160;</div>
            </td>
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">continually
                broadening is product offerings in the transition from x-ray film
                to
                electronic imaging,</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 36pt">
              <div>&#160;</div>
            </td>
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">enhancing
                both its domestic and international distribution channels,
                and</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 36pt">
              <div>&#160;</div>
            </td>
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">expanding
                its world-wide market presence in the diagnostic, dental imaging
                field.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">On
      April
      19, 2007, the Company completed the acquisition of Quantitative Radiology srl,
      an Italian corporation (&#8220;QR&#8221;), by acquiring all of the outstanding share capital
      of QR from the shareholders.&#160;&#160;QR is a global supplier of
      state-of-the-art, in-office three-dimensional dental computed tomography
      (CT).&#160;&#160;QR uses an imaging technology that features a cone shaped beam
      of x-rays (a CBCT scanner).&#160;&#160;The Company, prior to April 19, 2007, had
      acted as QR&#8217;s exclusive distributor in North and South America, excluding
      Brazil.&#160;&#160;Funding for the acquisition was principally derived from two
      sources; the first was the proceeds raised from a private offering of the
      Company&#8217;s common stock to equity investors and the second was a portion of the
      loan proceeds from ComVest Capital, LLC in connection with a term loan and
      revolving credit facility.&#160;&#160;In connection with the acquisition, the
      Company, entered into employment agreements with each of the former
      shareholders&#8217; of QR.&#160;&#160;Each agreement contains a non-compete clause
      which prohibits the employee from engaging in activities competitive with the
      business of QR for a period of five years from the date of termination of
      employment.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">On
      April
      12, 2007, the Company completed the sale of an aggregate of 5,500,000 shares
      of
      its common stock to certain accredited investors for an aggregate consideration
      of $8,140,000 pursuant to previously executed subscription
      agreements.&#160;&#160;The common stock was issued and sold pursuant to the
      exemption from registration afforded by Regulation D of the Securities Act
      of
      1933, as amended.&#160;&#160;In connection with the transaction, the Company
      paid the placement agent for the offering $407,000, or five percent of the
      gross
      proceeds of the offering.&#160;&#160;The proceeds were used for the purchase of
      QR.&#160;&#160;The Company has granted the investors certain registration rights
      with respect to the resale of the shares acquired and agreed to register these
      shares of common stock.&#160;&#160;The Company is subject to specific penalties
      if the registration statement is not filed within a certain time.&#160;&#160;The
      Company has received an extension of the time allowed to file this registration
      statement from the investors until October 15, 2007, so as to incorporate the
      information contained within this Annual Report on Form 10K.&#160;&#160;The
      Company believes that any payments of penalties related to this registration
      statement are remote.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">On
      April
      13, 2007, the Company entered into a Revolving Credit and Term Loan Agreement
      with ComVest Capital, LLC (&#8220;ComVest&#8221;) whereby ComVest agreed to lend the Company
      an aggregate of up to $8 million in the form of a $5 million term loan and
      a $3
      million revolving loan facility.&#160;&#160;The term loan bears interest at a
      rate of ten percent (10%) per annum and provides for repayment over five years
      commencing in November 2007; and the revolving loans bear interest at a rate
      per
      annum of two percent (2%) plus the prime rate and is payable in full on April
      30, 2012.&#160;&#160;The Company and each of its wholly-owned subsidiaries
      executed a Collateral Agreement pursuant to which each such party agreed to
      grant a security interest in all of its respective assets to ComVest as
      collateral security for repayment of the loans.&#160;&#160;This new senior
      secured Revolving Credit and Term Loan Agreement replaced the Company&#8217;s previous
      $2.5 million senior secured credit facility, which was due to expire on
      September 21, 2007.&#160;&#160;As part of the transaction, the Company granted
      to ComVest an aggregate of 800,000 warrants to purchase shares of the Company&#8217;s
      common stock at exercise prices per share equal to $1.85 with respect to 266,666
      warrants, $2.02 with respect to an additional 266,666 warrants, and $2.19 with
      respect to the remaining 266,668 warrants.&#160;&#160;The Company entered into a
      Registration Rights Agreement pursuant to which it has agreed to register the
      shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of the warrants and conversion
      of
      the term note. The Company is subject to specific penalties if the registration
      statement is not filed within a certain time and then declared effective within
      a certain time.&#160;&#160;The Company must also use its best efforts to keep
      the registration statement effective during the applicable registration
      period.&#160;&#160;The Company has received an extension of the time allowed to
      file this registration statement from ComVest until October 15, 2007, so as
      to
      incorporate the information contained within this Annual Report on Form
      10K.&#160;&#160;The Company believes that any payments of penalties related to
      this registration statement are remote.</font></div>
    <div><br>&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">4</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">In
      December 2006, the Company completed the acquisition of a domestic distribution
      channel for a portion of its digital, dental product line.&#160;&#160;This
      channel will provide the Company with an additional sales and support function
      and will focus on direct sales to the actual professional end user . The Company
      will also maintain its historic dealer sales, where
      applicable.&#160;&#160;Digital, dental products sold through this channel will
      also utilize the Company&#8217;s various brands.&#160;&#160;Evolving market trends,
      distributor consolidations and competition requires that the Company develop
      this capability for direct, domestic sales representation.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">In
      May
      2006, the Company completed a private offering of its common stock to selected
      institutional and other accredited investors.&#160;&#160;The offering was priced
      at $1.80 per share and 2,777,777 shares of common stock were
      sold.&#160;&#160;The proceeds were used for the purchase of QR.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">In
      February 2005, the Company settled an outstanding environmental litigation
      claim
      which had been filed in 2001 as a civil complaint by the current owners of
      property, which the Company had owned between August 1984 and June
      1985.&#160;&#160;The Company paid $325,000, which represented its entire
      liability under the settlement offer.&#160;&#160;See Item 3, Legal Proceedings
      for a further discussion of this matter.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>b)
      Financial Information about Industry Segments</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company is engaged in one industry segment; the manufacture and distribution
      of
      medical and dental x-ray imaging equipment and accessories.&#160;&#160;Prior to
      July 2001, when the Company sold the assets related to its graphic arts
      subsidiary, the Company had been engaged in two industry segments, the
      manufacture and distribution of medical/dental x-ray equipment and accessories,
      and graphic arts, film processing equipment.&#160;&#160;The Company has agreed
      not to compete in this same business line of graphic arts film processing
      equipment for ten years, to expire in July 2011.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s
      business segments, until July 2001, were based on significant differences in
      the
      nature of the Company&#8217;s operations, including distribution channels and
      customers.&#160;&#160;The composition of the current industry segment is
      consistent with that used by the Company&#8217;s management in making strategic
      decisions.&#160;&#160;See Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements for
      further discussion of industry segments.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>c)
      Narrative Description of Business</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Principal
      Products and Services</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><u>Cone
      Beam CT Scanners &#8211; Three Dimensional Imaging</u></font></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company, through QR, its Italian subsidiary, designs, manufactures and
      distributes a dental CT scanner capable of generating and reconstructing
      three-dimensional images of the teeth, jaws and surrounding dental
      anatomy.&#160;&#160;For many clinical procedures, it is an important diagnostic
      improvement over historical two-dimensional film images.&#160;&#160;The system
      utilizes a conical shaped x-ray cone beam (&#8220;CBCT&#8221;) that rotates around the skull
      and passes through the teeth, at many angles, thus creating unique,
      radiographic, dental information that is captured digitally.&#160;&#160;The
      Company&#8217;s proprietary software then reconstructs a three-dimensional image from
      the data.&#160;&#160;QR has been providing this technology to world-wide markets
      for over ten years.&#160;&#160;The primary users are dentists, implant
      specialists, oral surgeons and orthodontists, as well as Ear, Nose and Throat
      medical specialists. The configuration includes a horizontal patient table
      support system that assists positioning for complex cases involving the elderly,
      the infirm or small children.&#160;&#160;The Company has also introduced a
      vertical, standing CBCT model where a patient can be seated or standing upright
      during the examination.&#160;&#160;This model also provides user flexibility for
      smaller examination rooms.&#160;&#160;The Company completed the acquisition of
      QR on April 19, 2007.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><u>Digital
      Dental and Large Body Digital Imaging Systems &#8211; Two Dimensional
      Imaging</u></font></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company manufactures, distributes and services film-less, digital radiography
      sensors in various image format sizes, utilizing x-rays and electronic imaging
      software.&#160;&#160;The equipment generates and captures two dimensional,
      dental x-ray images with these sensors, in place of film, and then displays
      them
      using the Company&#8217;s software.&#160;&#160;Digital radiographic systems, referred
      to as DR Systems (direct radiography), have practical applications in both
      human
      and companion animal diagnostics.&#160;&#160;Veterinary dentistry has become a
      growing and important discipline and treatment procedure.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company has developed proprietary software for each application.&#160;&#160;DR
      systems can be either &#8220;postage stamp size&#8221;, larger for equine applications or in
      the largest format to be installed in x-ray tables for companion animal (pets)
      whole body examinations.&#160;&#160;The primary benefit for the professional is
      the improved display of diagnostic information, clinical efficiency and the
      flexibility of electronic radiographs for referrals and storage.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">5</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><u>Dental
      X-Ray Systems</u></font></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company distributes digital and analog dental x-ray machines, manufactured
      by
      others.&#160;&#160;The Company has the exclusive distribution rights in the
      North American markets for a well established, European-designed, intraoral
      dental x-ray and a panoramic/cephalometric dental x-ray unit. The latter
      provides, all in one view, a full format image for the diagnosis of the entire
      upper and lower dental arches and jaws.&#160;&#160;These dental products can be
      supplied to the market with a digital, filmless x-ray sensor that is compatible
      with the Company&#8217;s software.&#160;&#160;Panoramic units are typically used by
      dentists, orthodontists, oral surgeons, and endodontists for specific patient
      treatment plans where three dimensional imaging is not required.&#160;&#160;When
      existing, installed equipment utilizes analog x-ray film that can be developed
      in the Company&#8217;s well established line of processors.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><u>Veterinary
      Imaging and Radiographic Table Systems</u></font></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company manufactures and distributes a line of x-ray tables and related
      equipment specifically designed for the veterinary marketplace.&#160;&#160;They
      include x-ray systems for film or digital dental radiography, a portable digital
      imaging system for the diagnosis of equine extremities and a large size
      filmless, x-ray sensor used in conjunction with general radiographic equipment.
      The Company distributes general-purpose x-ray systems and related imaging
      components specifically designed for veterinary applications.&#160;&#160;They
      are marketed under the Company&#8217;s trademark &#8220;VetTek.&#8221;&#160;&#160;These systems
      are designed to offer the user either digital or film based image capture
      systems and allows the veterinarian to perform either dental or general
      radiography.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><u>&#160;X-Ray
      Processors &amp; Accessories</u></font></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company manufactures and distributes a line of medical, dental and industrial
      x-ray film processors.&#160;&#160;These are commonly referred to as analog
      film-based systems.&#160;&#160;The machines automatically process or develop
      x-ray films.&#160;&#160;The exposed film is inserted into the equipment and
      returned to the operator developed, fixed, washed and dried.&#160;&#160;The
      equipment can be located either in a dark room site or adapted to a daylight
      loading system.&#160;&#160;These analog units are used for diagnostic x-ray
      imaging and industrial, non-destructive testing applications.&#160;&#160;These
      products are distributed worldwide through an unaffiliated dealer network to
      doctors, dentists, veterinarians, hospitals, medical clinics, and the U.S.
      government.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Patents
      and Trademarks</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company presently holds or has licensed a number of domestic and foreign utility
      patents, which the Company believes are material to the technology used in
      its
      products.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s intellectual property includes several
      patents obtained in connection with prior acquisitions.&#160;&#160;The Company
      is not aware of any patents or other intellectual property held by others that
      conflict with the Company&#8217;s current product designs.&#160;&#160;However, there
      can be no assurance that infringement claims will not be asserted against the
      Company in the future.&#160;&#160;Patent applications have been filed where
      appropriate.&#160;&#160;The Company owns several domestic and foreign
      trademarks, which it uses in connection with the marketing of its products,
      including:&#160;&#160;AFP Imaging, DENT-X, ENDOS, EVA,&#160;&#160;NewTom 3G,
      VetTek and DIGI-VET, among others.&#160;&#160;The Company believes that these
      utility patents and trademarks are important to its operations and the loss
      or
      infringement by others of or to its rights to such patents and trademarks could
      have a material adverse effect on the Company.&#160;&#160;Even with the patent
      rights for the Company&#8217;s products, the Company&#8217;s technology may not preclude or
      inhibit competitors from producing products that have substantially similar
      performance specifications as the Company&#8217;s products.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company has agreed to pay a nominal royalty on the domestic sales of its digital
      dental systems to a third party under a license for the use of the third party&#8217;s
      software format for the computer display of such images.&#160;&#160;This royalty
      will cease if and when the Company introduces a modified version of its software
      which does not use the third party&#8217;s software format.&#160;&#160;The Company
      also has agreed to pay a royalty to a third party on the worldwide sales of
      its
      digital dental sensors, under a license to use certain technology developed
      and
      owned by the third party and utilized in the sensor&#8217;s internal
      operations.&#160;&#160;The Company is dependant to some degree on this
      third-party license, and the loss or inability to replace this license could
      result in increased costs as well as substantial delays or reductions in product
      shipments.&#160;&#160;The principal technology applied to the construction of
      the Company&#8217;s other products may be considered proprietary.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Research
      and Development</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      amounts spent by the Company during each of the Company&#8217;s last three fiscal
      years on primary research activities relating to the development of new products
      and the improvement of existing products, all of which was Company sponsored,
      are as follows:</font></div>
    <div><br></div>

        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">

      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">6</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>

      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company conducts research and development activities internally in its Elmsford,
      New York facility as well as in its Verona, Italy facility, and contracts out
      certain projects to qualified vendors and external consultants.&#160;&#160;The
      Company&#8217;s research and development efforts and technologies have been
      significantly enhanced by the acquisition of QR on April 19,
      2007.&#160;&#160;The Company has integrated its research and development between
      both locations.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Raw
      Materials</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company manufactures and&#160;&#160;assembles its products at its facilities in
      Elmsford, New York and Verona, Italy, both of which are ISO 9001/2000
      (International Standards Organization) certified.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s
      products are manufactured from parts and components obtained from numerous
      unaffiliated suppliers and/or fabricated internally.&#160;&#160;In most cases,
      the Company does not utilize any unique processes, nor does it traditionally
      have difficulties in obtaining raw materials in the manufacture of its
      products.&#160;&#160;The Company owns proprietary designs and tooling to produce
      the digital x-ray sensors and other components that are in the physical
      possession of vendors.&#160;&#160;Although the Company anticipates that an
      adequate commercial supply of necessary raw materials and components will remain
      available from various sources, the loss of the Company&#8217;s relationship with a
      particular supplier could result in productions delays.&#160;&#160;However, such
      a loss is not expected to materially adversely affect the Company&#8217;s long term
      business, as the proprietary component or designs can be reproduced
      elsewhere.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Warranties</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company generally warrants each of its products against defects in materials
      and
      workmanship for a period of one to two years, depending upon the product, from
      the date of shipment plus any extended warranty period purchased by the
      customer.&#160;&#160;The Company offers a three year warranty for the digital,
      dental sensors.&#160;&#160;The need to fulfill warranty claims by the Company&#8217;s
      customers or dealers could potentially have an adverse effect on the Company
      by
      requiring additional expenditures for replacements, materials and/or
      labor.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Sales,
      Marketing and Distribution</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company&#8217;s manufactured and outsourced products are distributed both domestically
      and internationally to end users and independent medical and dental dealers
      or
      distributors.&#160;&#160;These dealers install and service our
      products.&#160;&#160;The Company advertises and markets under its own brands and
      trade names.&#160;&#160;Certain 3-D imaging products are imported from its
      Verona, Italy facility.&#160;&#160;Others items come from foreign suppliers for
      sale in North America.&#160;&#160;The Company has also expanded its dental sales
      efforts by acquiring a direct sales distribution channel.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company conducts worldwide marketing and regional sales efforts through trade
      show attendance and promotion.&#160;&#160;The Company advertises in domestic and
      international journals, provides sales support and literature, prepares
      technical manuals and conducts customer education and training programs in
      order
      to promote its products.&#160;&#160;In addition, the Company participates in
      domestic and international technical support.&#160;&#160;The Company maintains
      various web sites, which provide an easy-to-navigate, on-line information
      resource.&#160;&#160;It includes Company information, product description and
      extensive technical specifications and information.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Government
      Regulation</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company&#8217;s medical and dental products are subject to government regulation in
      the United States and certain other countries.&#160;&#160;The United States Food
      and Drug Administration (&#8220;FDA&#8221;) regulates the distribution of all equipment used
      as medical devices.&#160;&#160;The Company must comply with the procedures and
      standards established by the FDA and comparable foreign regulatory
      agencies.&#160;&#160;The Company believes it has registered all of its
      applicable medical and dental products with the FDA, and that all of its
      products and procedures satisfy all the criteria necessary to comply with FDA
      regulations.&#160;&#160;The FDA has the right to disapprove the marketing of any
      medical device that fails to comply with FDA regulations.&#160;&#160;The
      Company&#8217;s manufacturing facilities are ISO 9001/2000 certified.&#160;&#160;Where
      applicable, the Company&#8217;s products are Conformite&#8217; Europeenne (&#8220;CE&#8221;) certified
      for sales within the European Union.&#160;&#160;Any future changes in existing
      regulations, or adoption of additional regulations, domestically or
      internationally, which govern devices such as the Company&#8217;s medical and dental
      products have the potential to have a material adverse effect on the Company&#8217;s
      ability to market its existing products or to market new products. The Company
      engages specialized, expert consultants for the preparation of FDA
      applications.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company is also subject to other international, federal, state, and local laws,
      regulations and recommendations relating to safe working conditions and
      manufacturing processes.&#160;&#160;The Company believes it is in compliance
      with such rules.</font></div>
    <div><br>&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">7</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">International
      sales of our products are subject to the regulatory agency product registration
      requirements of each country in which the Company&#8217;s products are
      sold.&#160;&#160;The regulatory review process varies from country to
      country.&#160;&#160;The Company typically relies on its distributors in foreign
      countries to obtain the required regulatory approvals.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Product
      Liability Exposure</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company&#8217;s business involves the inherent risk of product liability
      claims.&#160;&#160;The Company currently maintains general product liability
      insurance as well as an umbrella liability policy, which the Company believes
      are sufficient to protect the Company from any potential risks to which it
      may
      be subject.&#160;&#160;However, there can be no assurances that product
      liability insurance coverage will continue to be available or, if available,
      that it can be obtained in sufficient amounts or at a reasonable
      cost.&#160;&#160;See Item 3. Legal Proceedings, for further discussion of any
      outstanding product liability claims.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Seasonal
      Nature</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Historically,
      the Company&#8217;s fourth quarter revenues of any fiscal year have been higher than
      the subsequent first quarter&#8217;s revenues.&#160;&#160;This is due to aggressive
      fourth quarter marketing, followed by lower customer demand in the first fiscal
      quarter attributed to summer holidays and traditional foreign business closings
      during July and August.&#160;&#160;The Company expects future net sales and
      operating results to continue to reflect this general seasonality.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Working
      Capital Practices</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company believes its practices regarding inventories, receivables or other
      items
      of working capital to be typical for the industry involved.&#160;&#160;On April
      13, 2007, the Company entered into a new senior secured credit facility (the
      Revolving Credit and Term Loan) with ComVest Capital, LLC that replaced the
      Company&#8217;s existing $2.5 million revolving line of credit that was due to expire
      on September 21, 2007.&#160;&#160;The Revolving Credit and Term Loan consists of
      a $5 million convertible term note and a $3 million revolving loan
      facility.&#160;&#160;The convertible term note bears interest at a rate of ten
      percent per annum and provides for repayment over five years commencing in
      November 2007 with a final balloon payment of all remaining amounts due
      there-under on April 30, 2012.&#160;&#160;The convertible term note, in addition
      to being convertible by the Company upon the satisfaction of certain conditions,
      including a trading price equal to 175% of the conversion price and the
      Company&#8217;s common stock being traded on Nasdaq, is convertible by the lender at
      any time into shares of common stock at a conversion price of $2.37 per share,
      or 2,109,705 shares based on the initial principal amount of the convertible
      term note.&#160;&#160;The revolving loan bears interest at a rate of two percent
      plus prime rate per annum, currently equal to 9.75%, has a specific formula
      to
      calculate available funds based on eligible accounts receivable and inventory,
      is subject to certain maximum borrowing base requirements, has certain reporting
      requirements to the lender, and is payable in full on April 12,
      2012.&#160;&#160;The Company and each of its wholly-owned subsidiaries executed
      a Collateral Agreement pursuant to which each such party agreed to grant a
      security interest in all of its respective assets to ComVest as collateral
      security for repayment of the loans.&#160;&#160;The Revolving Credit and Term
      Loan is secured by all of our and our wholly-owned subsidiaries inventory,
      accounts receivable, equipment, officer life insurance policies and proceeds
      thereof, trademarks, licenses, patents and general intangibles.&#160;&#160;It is
      believed that the Revolving Credit and Term Loan is sufficient to finance our
      ongoing working capital requirements for the foreseeable future.&#160;&#160;The
      Revolving Credit and Term Loan Agreement has a specific formula to calculate
      available funds based on eligible accounts receivable and inventory, is subject
      to maximum borrowing base limitations, and has certain reporting
      requirements.&#160;&#160;As part of the transaction, the Company granted to
      ComVest an aggregate of 800,000 warrants to purchase shares of the Company&#8217;s
      common stock at exercise prices per share equal to $1.85 with respect to 266,666
      warrants, $2.02 with respect to an additional 266,666 warrants, and $2.19 with
      respect to the remaining 266,668 warrants.&#160;&#160;The Black-Scholes Method
      was used to value these detachable warrants, and have been recorded in the
      accompanying Consolidated Balance Sheets at $1,114,784.&#160;&#160;The Company
      entered into a Registration Rights Agreement pursuant to which it has agreed
      to
      register the shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of the warrants
      and
      conversion of the term note.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">In
      September 2001, in connection with the entry into a previous line of credit
      with
      its former lender, the Company issued a 5-year warrant for the purchase of
      100,000 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock at $.32 per share, subject to
      adjustment for all subsequent issuances of stock.&#160;&#160;The expiration date
      of this warrant was September 21, 2006.&#160;&#160;In August and September 2006,
      the former lender exercised the warrant and converted the warrant into 82,806
      shares of common stock in a cashless exercise in a manner as specified in the
      warrant.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Customers</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">In
      the
      Company&#8217;s fiscal years ended June 30, 2007, 2006 and 2005 there were no sales to
      any one customer which accounted for 10% or more of the Company&#8217;s total
      consolidated sales.&#160;&#160;Management believes that the loss of any one
      customer would have an adverse effect on the Company&#8217;s consolidated business for
      a short period of time as the Company seeks new customers.</font></div>
    <div><br>&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">8</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Backlog
      Orders</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">As
      of June
      30, 2007, the Company&#8217;s backlog of orders for its products was approximately
      $2,668,900 as compared to $1,066,839 as of June 30, 2006.&#160;&#160;All of the
      orders included in the backlog at June 30, 2007 are scheduled for delivery
      on or
      before June 30, 2008.&#160;&#160;Spare part sales are not included in the
      Company&#8217;s backlog calculations.&#160;&#160;In the opinion of the Company,
      fluctuations in the backlog and its size at any given time are not necessarily
      indicative of intermediate or long-term trends in the Company&#8217;s
      business.&#160;&#160;Much of the Company&#8217;s backlog can be canceled or the
      delivery dates of orders can be accelerated or extended without
      penalty.&#160;&#160;Delivery of capital equipment is frequently subject to
      changing economic or budget conditions of medical institutions and end user
      clinical practitioners, which can vary significantly between fiscal
      periods.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Government
      Contracts</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company did not fulfill any significant contracts in Fiscal Years 2007, 2006
      and
      2005 with the United States Government that were material to the Company&#8217;s
      consolidated business.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s policy is to be responsive to
      all governmental Requests for Quotations (RFQ), which can be fulfilled by items
      within the scope of the Company&#8217;s product lines.&#160;&#160;Several government
      agencies also procure equipment directly, without contract awards.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Competition</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">&#160;&#160;The
      Company is subject to both foreign and domestic
      competition.&#160;&#160;Competitors have made significant investments in
      research and development of new technologies, products and
      services.&#160;&#160;Some competitors are well established in similar
      manufacturing and distribution businesses and may have greater financial,
      manufacturing and distribution resources than the Company.&#160;&#160;With
      respect to all of its products, the Company competes on the basis of function,
      features, product specifications, price per application, promptness of delivery
      and customer service.&#160;&#160;The Company purchases certain products from
      others for resale on a non-exclusive basis, which may be subject to competition
      from the suppliers or other independent distributors.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company also competes in the dental imaging market on the basis of its
      proprietary and patented technologies.&#160;&#160;Certain competitors have
      significant or greater resources and revenues in electronic digital imaging
      technologies and expertise in software development utilized in dental imaging
      products.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      market
      for technology professional services is intensely competitive, rapidly evolving
      and subject to rapid technological change.&#160;&#160;The Company expects
      competition not only to persist, but also to increase.&#160;&#160;Competition
      may result in price reductions, reduced margins and loss of market
      share.&#160;&#160;The market for the Company&#8217;s goods and services is rapidly
      evolving and is subject to continuous technological change.&#160;&#160;As a
      result, the Company&#8217;s competitors may be better positioned to address these
      developments or may react more favorably to these changes.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">While
      the
      Company believes its products are competitive in terms of capabilities, quality
      and price, increased competition in the marketplace could have an adverse effect
      on the Company&#8217;s business and, recent business mergers and acquisitions may have
      potentially adversely affect the Company&#8217;s business.&#160;&#160;Many of the
      Company&#8217;s competitors are much larger with significantly greater financial,
      sales, marketing and other resources than those of the Company.&#160;&#160;There
      can be no assurance that these competitors are not currently developing or
      will
      attempt to develop new products that are more effective than those of the
      Company or that might render the Company&#8217;s products noncompetitive or
      obsolete.&#160;&#160;No assurances can be given that the Company will be able to
      compete successfully with such competitors in the future.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Environmental</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company believes it is in compliance with the current laws and regulations,
      in
      the United States and Italy, governing the protection of the environment and
      that continued compliance would not have a material adverse effect on the
      Company or require any material capital expenditures.&#160;&#160;Compliance with
      local codes for the installation and operation of the Company&#8217;s products is the
      responsibility of the end user, or the dealer who independently provides
      installation services.&#160;&#160;See Item 3, Legal Proceedings, for further
      discussion of an environmental claim in which the Company is
      involved.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Employees</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">As
      of June
      30, 2007, the Company employed 115 people on a full-time basis,
      world-wide.&#160;&#160;The Company has no collective bargaining agreements and
      considers its relationship with its employees to be satisfactory.&#160;&#160;The
      Company&#8217;s Italian subsidiary conforms to their statutory, Italian labor
      regulations, which includes a mandatory severance indemnity.&#160;&#160;All
      Italian employees are entitled to an indemnity upon termination of their
      employment relationship for any reason.&#160;&#160;The respective benefit
      accrues to each employee on a pro-rata basis during their employment period
      and
      is based upon their respective salary.&#160;&#160;The vested benefit payable
      accrues interest.</font></div>
    <div><br>&#160;</div>

              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="15%">
                <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;&#160;&#160;($3,452,175)</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="9%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="15%">
                <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">--</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="9%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="15%">
                <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">--</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="9%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td valign="top" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="27%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="15%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="9%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="15%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="9%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="15%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
