            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td valign="top" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="27%">
                <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><u>Identifiable
                  assets</u></font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="15%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="9%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="15%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="9%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="15%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="9%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td valign="top" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="27%">
                <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">United
                  States</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="15%">
                <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$9,942,023</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="9%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="15%">
                <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$14,340,564</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="9%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="15%">
                <div align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$8,153,396</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="9%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td valign="top" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="27%">
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">Europe</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="15%">
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$17,228,803</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="9%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="15%">
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">--</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="9%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="top" width="15%">
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">--</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="9%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Assets
      used in the manufacture of export sales are integrated with the other assets
      of
      the Company.&#160;&#160;The intangibles, the amortization of the intangibles,
      and the write-off of the in-process research and development, all associated
      with the acquisition of QR, has been attributed to the Italian
      operations.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Included
      above are the operating results of QR, the Company&#8217;s foreign subsidiary,
      effective April 19, 2007, the acquisition date.&#160;&#160;Prior to such time,
      the Company only maintained domestic operations.&#160;&#160;No one foreign
      country or geographic area comprised 10% or more of consolidated sales for
      the
      fiscal years ended June 30, 2007, 2006 and 2005.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Item
      1A.&#160;&#160;Risk Factors.</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><u>Business
      Risks</u></strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>We
      are dependent on a limited number of products and any material decrease in
      revenues from any one of these products could have an adverse impact on our
      revenue and financial position.</strong>&#160;&#160;Our revenues primarily are
      generated from sales of our digital dental sensors, three-dimensional digital
      Cone Beam CT scanners, panoramic and intra-oral x-ray machines, and analog
      processor products.&#160;&#160;We can give no assurance that any of these
      systems and products, or any of the other products which we currently sell,
      or
      may sell in the future, will not be rendered obsolete or inferior as a result
      of
      technological change, changing customer demands, new product introductions
      or
      other developments.&#160;&#160;There also can be no assurance that our
      competitors will not succeed in developing or marketing technologies, systems
      and products that are superior to and/or more commercially attractive than
      our
      technologies, systems and products.&#160;&#160;The rendering obsolete or
      inferior of our technologies, systems and products could have a material adverse
      effect on us.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Further,
      our success will depend in part on our ability to improve and enhance our
      technologies, systems and products timely in comparison to our
      competitors.&#160;&#160;There can be no assurance that we will be able to do
      so.&#160;&#160;Our failure to improve and enhance any of our technologies,
      systems and products in a timely manner could have a material adverse effect
      on
      us.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>A
      failure to adapt to technological changes within our industry could have an
      adverse effect on our operating results.</strong>&#160;&#160;Our success will
      depend on our ability to keep pace with technological developments of new
      products and services and our ability to fulfill increasingly sophisticated
      customer demands.&#160;&#160;The medical, dental and veterinary imaging
      equipment and service markets are characterized by rapidly changing technology
      and frequent introductions of new products, services and product and service
      enhancements, both equipment and software modifications and
      upgrades..&#160;&#160;There can be no assurance that we will be able to provide
      the products, services and support necessary to remain
      competitive.&#160;&#160;If we were to incur delays in sourcing and developing
      new products and services or enhancements to our current lines of products
      and
      services, such delays could have a material adverse effect on our operations
      and
      financial results.</font></div>
    <div><br>&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">10</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>We
      are subject to substantial competition which could adversely affect our
      operating results.</strong>&#160;&#160;The markets in which we operate are
      highly competitive with respect to performance, quality and price.&#160;&#160;We
      directly compete with local, regional, national and international manufacturers
      and distributors of medical, dental and veterinary imaging
      equipment.&#160;&#160;In the future, we may face further competition from new
      market entrants and possible alliances between existing competitors. Some of
      our
      competitors have, or may have, greater financial, marketing and other resources
      than us.&#160;&#160;As a result, competitors may be able to respond more quickly
      to new or emerging technologies and changes in customer requirements, benefit
      from greater purchasing economies, offer more aggressive hardware and service
      pricing to customers, or devote greater resources to the promotion of their
      products and services than we are capable of accomplishing.&#160;&#160;There can
      be no assurance that we will be able to successfully compete in the future
      with
      such competitors.&#160;&#160;The failure to successfully compete could have an
      adverse effect on our operating results.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>The
      market for professional technology services is intensely competitive, rapidly
      evolving and subject to rapid technological change.</strong>&#160;&#160;We
      expect competition not only to persist, but to increase.&#160;&#160;Competition
      may result in price reductions, reduced margins and loss of market
      share.&#160;&#160;The market for our goods and services is rapidly evolving and
      is subject to continuous technological change.&#160;&#160;As a result, our
      competitors may be better positioned to address these developments or may react
      more favorably to these changes.&#160;&#160;Existing or future competitors may
      develop or offer strategic services that provide significant technological,
      creative, performance, price or other advantages over the services that we
      offer.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Our
      growth will depend on our ability to continue to develop our
      brands.</strong>&#160;&#160;We believe that strengthening our brands will be
      critical to achieving widespread acceptance of our products and
      services.&#160;&#160;Promoting and positioning our brands will depend largely on
      the success of our marketing efforts and ability to provide high quality
      products and services.&#160;&#160;In order to promote our brands, we will need
      to increase our marketing budget and otherwise increase our financial commitment
      to creating and maintaining brand loyalty among our customers.&#160;&#160;Brand
      promotion activities may not yield increased revenues and, even if they do,
      any
      increased revenues may not offset the expenses that we incur in building our
      brands.&#160;&#160;If we fail to promote and maintain our brands or incur
      substantial expenses in an unsuccessful attempt to promote and maintain our
      brands, our&#160;&#160;business would be harmed.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>We
      will be dependent on key management and advisors</strong>.&#160;&#160;Our
      success is highly dependent on our ability to attract and retain experienced
      management and industry personnel to supplement our present management
      team.&#160;&#160;The loss of the services or advice of any one or more of these
      persons, whether part of the present management or new hires, could have a
      material adverse effect on our business. We face considerable competition from
      other entities in the fields in which we operate and with other entities for
      qualified personnel, many of which have significantly greater resources than
      us.&#160;&#160;We may be unable to offer key employees compensation of the type
      and quantity that our competitors and other entities can offer.&#160;&#160;There
      can be no assurance that we will be able to attract and retain personnel in
      the
      future, and the inability to do so could have material adverse effects on
      us.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>We
      are significantly dependent upon the continued availability of Donald
      Rabinovitch, our president and co-chief executive officer, David Vozick, our
      chairman and co-chief executive officer,&#160;&#160;Roberto Molteni, our
      executive vice-president of technology and our new sales and marketing team
      recently hired to help transition the sale of our products to the final
      users</strong>.&#160;&#160;We currently do not have employment agreements with
      any of these executive officers.&#160;&#160;The loss or unavailability to us of
      any of Messrs. Rabinovitch, Vozick or Molteni for an extended period of time
      could have a material adverse effect on our business operations and
      prospects.&#160;&#160;To the extent that their services would be unavailable to
      us for any reason, we would be required to procure other personnel to manage
      and
      operate us.&#160;&#160;There can be no assurance that we will be able to locate
      or employ such qualified personnel on acceptable terms.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>We
      are dependent on our key personnel and ability to recruit, train and retain
      technology professionals.</strong>&#160;&#160;Our current and planned operations
      will depend in large part on our ability to identify, hire, train and retain
      technology professionals and sales and senior management personnel who can
      provide the technical, strategic, creative, marketing and audience development
      skills required by our clients and for our financial success.&#160;&#160;There
      is a shortage of qualified personnel in these fields and we compete with other
      companies, both those within the industry in which we operate and those in
      other
      industries, for this limited pool of technology professionals and sales and
      senior management personnel.&#160;&#160;There is no assurance that we will be
      able to attract, train, or retain such qualified personnel.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Further,
      additions of new and departures of existing personnel, particularly in key
      positions, can be disruptive, which also could have a material adverse effect
      upon us, the result of which could have a negative impact on our operations
      and
      financial results.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Our
      dependence on third party licenses could have adverse
      effects.</strong>&#160;&#160;We rely on certain software, technology and
      products that we have licensed from third parties, including software,
      technologies and products that are integrated with internally developed software
      and/or used in our products to perform key functions. These third-party licenses
      may not continue to be available for use on commercially reasonable
      terms.&#160;&#160;Also, the licensed software, technologies and products may not
      be appropriately supported, maintained or enhanced by the licensors such that
      the license would not continue to provide the necessary commercial benefits
      to
      us.&#160;&#160;In addition, we may not be able to license additional software,
      technologies and products in the future on terms advantageous to
      us.&#160;&#160;The loss of or inability to obtain or replace licenses to, or
      inability to support, maintain and enhance, any of such licensed software,
      could
      result in increased costs, including the expense of internally developing the
      required software, technologies and products, as well as delays or reductions
      in
      product shipments.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">11</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>There
      are a number of uncertainties associated with international sales that could
      adversely affect us.</strong>&#160;&#160;In each of our last three fiscal years,
      sales to customers outside of the United States exceeded 18% of our overall
      sales.&#160;&#160;We anticipate that international sales will continue to
      account for a similar portion of our overall sales
      revenue.&#160;&#160;International revenues are subject to a number of
      uncertainties, including, but not limited to:</font></div>
    <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">contracts
                may be difficult to enforce and receivables difficult to
                collect;</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">foreign
                customers and distributors may require longer payment
                cycles;</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td align="left" style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td align="left">
              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">foreign
                governments may impose additional withholding taxes or otherwise
                tax our
                foreign income, as well as&#160;&#160;impose tariffs or adopt other
                restrictions on foreign trade;</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">fluctuations
                in exchange rates may affect product
                demand;</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">United
                States export licenses may be difficult to obtain;
                and</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Intellectual
                property rights in foreign countries may be difficult or impossible
                to
                enforce.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Moreover,
      many foreign countries have their own regulatory approval requirements,
      including obtaining various licenses to operate in specific countries for the
      sale of our products.&#160;&#160;As a result, our introduction of new products
      into international markets could be hindered, costly and/or
      time-prohibited.&#160;&#160;There can be no assurance that we will be able to
      obtain the required regulatory approvals on a timely basis, if at
      all.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>We
      are subject to pricing pressures and variable foreign exchange rates, which
      could result in lower sales revenues and gross profits.</strong>&#160;&#160;We
      believe our prices and payment and delivery terms are
      competitive.&#160;&#160;However, certain competitors may offer more aggressive
      pricing and payment terms to customers.&#160;&#160;We have experienced, and
      expect to continue to experience pricing pressure, on our products and services
      due to competitive factors, including industry consolidation.&#160;&#160;In
      addition, we have seen a general weakness in the U.S. economy negatively
      impacting our operating results as dental, medical and veterinary professionals
      reduced their capital expenditures in response to such general economic
      weakness.&#160;&#160;In an attempt to stimulate sales to existing and new
      customers, we believe that pricing pressures may increase in the
      future.&#160;&#160;Decreasing prices for our products and services would require
      us to sell a greater number of products and services to achieve the same level
      of net sales and gross profit.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Seasonality
      can cause fluctuations in our revenues and operating
      results.</strong>&#160;&#160;We have seen seasonal variations in our revenues
      and operating results.&#160;&#160;Our fourth quarter results for a fiscal year
      have historically exceeded corresponding revenues and operating results for
      the
      first quarter of the following fiscal year. We expect our net sales and
      operating results to continue to reflect this seasonality.&#160;&#160;The
      seasonality of our operating results could result in fluctuations of the market
      price of our common stock.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>We
      have had and may continue to have fluctuations in our quarterly operating
      results.</strong>&#160;&#160;Our quarterly operating results have and, in the
      future, may fluctuate significantly, depending on a variety of factors, many
      of
      which are outside of our control.&#160;&#160;Factors that may affect our
      quarterly results include:</font></div>
    <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">the
                demand for our products and
                services;</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">the
                size, timing and timely fulfillment of orders for our products and
                services;</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">the
                level of product, price and service
                competition;</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">changes
                in average selling prices and product mix, which also could affect
                our
                profit&#160;&#160;margins;</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">changes
                in our sales incentive strategy, as well as sales personnel
                changes;</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">the
                mix of direct and indirect sales, product returns and
                rebates;</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">

            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">federal,
                state or local government
                regulation;</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">our
                ability to upgrade and develop our systems and infrastructure to
                accommodate growth;</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">

            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></font></div>
            </td>

              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">our
                ability to attract and retain qualified
                personnel;</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></font></div>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">the
                success of our brand building and marketing
                campaigns;</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">capital
                spending budgets of our customers;</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">the
                timing, size and mix of product and service orders and deliveries;
                and</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">General
                economic conditions and economic conditions specific to the industries
                in
                which we compete.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Our
      operating expenses and capital expenditures are based in large part on our
      expectations of future revenues</strong>.&#160;&#160;Therefore, if revenue
      levels are below expectations, operating results are likely to be adversely
      affected.&#160;&#160;Net income may be disproportionately affected by an
      unanticipated decline in revenue for a particular quarter because a relatively
      small amount of our expenses will vary with our revenue in the short
      term.&#160;&#160;As a result, we believe that period-to-period comparisons of
      our results of operations are not and will not necessarily be meaningful and
      should not be relied upon as any indication of future
      performance.&#160;&#160;Due to all of the foregoing factors, it is likely that
      in some future quarter our operating results will be below
      expectations.</font></div>
    <div><br>&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">12</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>We
      are dependent on third-party distributors and a loss of any of these
      distributors could adversely affect us.</strong>&#160;&#160;We distribute our
      products through third-party, independent distributors.&#160;&#160;Historically,
      a limited number of distributors have accounted for a significant portion of
      our
      overall revenues.&#160;&#160;In general, these distributors could discontinue
      marketing our products with little or no notice.&#160;&#160;Certain distributors
      also could market products which compete with our products.&#160;&#160;The loss
      of or significant reduction in revenues generated through one or more of our
      distributors could have a material adverse effect on our operating results
      and
      financial position.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>We
      are dependant upon transitioning the Company to selling directly to the end
      user
      in addition to selling to our existing distributor base.&#160;&#160;The
      financial operations of the Company are dependant upon a successful
      transition.&#160;&#160;</strong>We have recently hired a new sales and marketing
      team to sell our products directly to doctors, dentists and other direct users
      of&#160;&#160;our equipment.&#160;&#160;Their success will directly affect the
      financial results of the Company. <strong>&#160;</strong>At this time, we cannot
      predict how successful this transition will be.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>We
      are subject to the uncertainty of litigation results that could adversely impact
      our financial position.</strong>&#160;&#160;We are subject to a variety of legal
      actions relating to our business operations.&#160;&#160;Recent court decisions,
      legislative activity and regulatory enforcement may increase our exposure for
      claims by third-parties, including environmental claims.&#160;&#160;In some
      cases, substantial punitive damages may be sought.&#160;&#160;We currently have
      insurance coverage for some of these potential liabilities.&#160;&#160;Other
      potential liabilities may not be covered by insurance.&#160;&#160;In addition,
      insurers may dispute coverage or the amount of insurance may not be sufficient
      to cover the damages awarded.&#160;&#160;Further, certain types of damages, such
      as punitive damages, may not be covered by insurance and insurance coverage
      for
      all or certain forms of liability may become unavailable or prohibitively
      expensive in the future.&#160;&#160;An adverse outcome from a litigation matter
      could have a material adverse effect on us.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>We
      are subject to regulatory and legislative risks that could adversely affect
      our
      operations.</strong>&#160;&#160;We must obtain certain approvals and marketing
      clearances from governmental authorities, including the U.S. Food and Drug
      Administration (the FDA) and similar health authorities in foreign countries,
      to
      market and sell our products domestically and in such foreign
      countries.&#160;&#160;The FDA regulates the marketing, manufacturing, labeling,
      packaging, advertising, sale and distribution of medical devices, as do various
      foreign authorities in their respective jurisdictions.&#160;&#160;The FDA also
      enforces additional regulations regarding the safety of equipment utilizing
      x-rays.&#160;&#160;Various states impose similar regulations.&#160;&#160;Certain
      of our manufactured and imported products and product components, including
      our
      tomography CT systems, x-ray systems and sensors, are currently regulated by
      such authorities and certain of our future products will require approval or
      marketing clearance from such various governmental authorities, including the
      FDA.&#160;&#160;In addition, various additional requirements are imposed upon us
      to make us eligible to sell products to the federal government.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      FDA
      review process typically requires extended proceedings pertaining to the safety
      and efficacy of new products.&#160;&#160;A Section 510(k) application is
      required in order to market a new or modified medical device.&#160;&#160;If
      specifically required by the FDA, a pre-market approval may be
      necessary.&#160;&#160;This procedure, which must be completed prior to marketing
      a new medical device, is potentially expensive and time
      consuming.&#160;&#160;The procedure may delay or hinder a product<font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="WP TypographicSymbols, Courier New">=</font>s
      timely entry into the marketplace.&#160;&#160;Moreover, there can be no
      assurance that the review or approval process for these products by the FDA
      or
      any other applicable governmental authorities will occur in a timely fashion,
      if
      at all, or that additional regulations will not be adopted or current
      regulations amended in such a manner as will adversely affect us.&#160;&#160;In
      addition, final approval does not assure, in any manner, the success of the
      approved product.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">We
      also
      are subject to other federal, state and local laws, regulations and
      recommendations relating to safe working conditions and manufacturing
      practices.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">International
      sales of our products are subject to the regulatory agency product registration
      requirements of each country in which our products are sold.&#160;&#160;The
      regulatory review process varies from country to country and may in some cases
      require the submission of clinical data.&#160;&#160;We typically rely upon our
      distributors in foreign countries to obtain the required regulatory
      approvals.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      extent
      of government regulation that might result from any future legislation or
      administrative action cannot be accurately predicted.&#160;&#160;Failure to
      comply with regulatory requirements could have a material adverse effect on
      our
      operating results and financial condition.</font></div>
    <div><br>&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">13</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">In
      addition to legislative and regulatory concerns directly affecting us, our
      customers operate in the health care industry, which is highly
      regulated.&#160;&#160;Both existing and future governmental regulations directed
      at our customers could adversely impact us indirectly.&#160;&#160;Further,
      cost-containment efforts by health maintenance organizations may adversely
      affect the potential market for our products.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Changes
      or increases in, or failure to comply with, regulations applicable to our
      business could increase our costs.</strong>&#160;&#160;The industries in which
      we compete are subject to extensive regulation and licensing requirements under
      federal, state and local laws.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>We
      have product warranty exposure which could adversely affect our operating
      results and financial condition.</strong>&#160;&#160;We generally warrant each
      of our products against defects in materials and workmanship for a period of
      one
      to two years from the date of shipment, plus any extended warranty period
      purchased by the customer and three years for our digital
      sensors.&#160;&#160;The need for warranty service could have a material adverse
      effect on us by, among other things, requiring additional expenditures for
      parts
      and personnel, as well as damaging our reputation and goodwill.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Our
      inability to continue to service and install&#160;&#160;our various equipment
      could adversely affect our operating results and financial
      performance.&#160;&#160;</strong>We generally service and install our
      three-dimensional Cone Beam CT equipment as well as install our digital dental
      sensors sold to the end user.&#160;&#160;Although we maintain the proper
      personnel and equipment to service our existing and anticipated customers,
      there
      can be no assurances that we can completely satisfy all of our customers&#8217;
requirements.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>There
      is a potential for product recall and product liability
      claims</strong>.&#160;&#160;Our products may be subject to recall for unforeseen
      reasons.&#160;&#160;In addition, certain applications, including projected
      applications, of our products entail the risk of product liability
      claims.&#160;&#160;Such risks will exist even with respect to those products
      that have received, or in the future may receive, regulatory approval for
      commercial sale.&#160;&#160;These claims may be made by our customers,
      distributors or others.&#160;&#160;Although we have maintained insurance
      coverage related to product liability claims, no assurance can be given that
      product liability insurance coverage will continue to be available or, if
      available, that it can be obtained in sufficient amounts or at reasonable cost
      or that it will be sufficient to cover any claims that may arise.&#160;&#160;We
      do not maintain any insurance relating to potential recalls of our
      products.&#160;&#160;Costs associated with potential product recalls or product
      liability claims could have a material adverse effect on us.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Our
      inability to protect our intellectual property rights could prevent us from
      selling our products and hinder our financial
      performance.</strong>&#160;&#160;The technology and designs underlying our
      products may not be fully protected by patent rights.&#160;&#160;Our future
      success is dependent primarily on non-patented trade secrets and on the
      innovative skills, technological expertise and management abilities of our
      employees.&#160;&#160;Even with the patent rights in our products, our
      technology may not preclude or inhibit competitors from producing products
      that
      have identical performance as our products.&#160;&#160;In addition, we cannot
      guarantee that any protected trade secret could ultimately be proven valid
      if
      challenged.&#160;&#160;Any such challenge, with or without merit, could be time
      consuming to defend, result in costly litigation, divert the attention and
      resources of our management and, if successful, require us to pay monetary
      damages.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Our
      products may infringe the intellectual property rights of others which may
      cause
      us to incur unexpected costs or prevent us from selling our
      products.</strong>&#160;&#160;We believe our products do not infringe on the
      intellectual property rights of others.&#160;&#160;However, there can be no
      assurance that infringement claims will not be asserted against us in the future
      or that, if asserted, any infringement claim will be successfully defended.
      We
      also may be subject to legal proceedings and claims from time to time, including
      claims of alleged infringement of the patents, trademarks and other intellectual
      property rights of third parties.&#160;&#160;Intellectual property litigation is
      expensive and time-consuming and could divert the attention of our management
      away from running our business and seriously harm our business.&#160;&#160;If we
      were to discover that our products violated the intellectual property rights
      of
      others, we would have to obtain licenses from these parties in order to continue
      marketing our products without substantial re-engineering.&#160;&#160;We might
      not be able to obtain the necessary licenses on acceptable terms or at all
      and,
      if we could not obtain such licenses, we might not be able to re-engineer our
      products successfully or in a timely fashion.&#160;&#160;If we fail to address
      any infringement issues timely and successfully, we would be forced to incur
      significant costs, including damages and potentially satisfying indemnification
      obligations that we have with our customers, and we could be prevented from
      selling certain of our products.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Price
      competition could reduce market share or cause us to reduce prices to retain
      or
      recapture market share, which could reduce revenues and
      margins.</strong>&#160;&#160;Our operations generally face intense competition
      in all markets.&#160;&#160;The medical, dental and veterinary imaging industries
      have historically experienced price competition.&#160;&#160;This price
      competition could result in us losing market share in some markets or force
      us
      to reduce prices and thereby our profit margins in order to retain or recapture
      market share.&#160;&#160;Increased price competition in the future could further
      reduce revenues, profit margins and backlog.</font></div>
    <div><br>&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">14</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Increased
      advertising or better marketing by our competitors could cause us to lose market
      share and revenues, or cause us to incur increased costs in order to retain
      or
      recapture market share.</strong>&#160;&#160;Extensive advertising or effective
      marketing by competitors could cause us to lose market share and revenues,
      or
      cause us to increase our own marketing costs.&#160;&#160;In addition,
      competitors may change the types or mix of products or services
      offered.&#160;&#160;These changes may attract customers, causing us to lose
      market share and revenue or to incur costs to vary our own types or mix of
      products or services in response to such competitive factors.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>If
      we do not respond effectively to changing consumer preferences, our market
      share, revenues and profitability could decrease.</strong>&#160;&#160;Our future
      market share, revenues and profits will depend in part on our ability to
      anticipate, identify and respond to changing consumer preferences of
      professionals who utilize medical, dental and veterinary imaging
      equipment.&#160;&#160;We may not correctly anticipate or identify trends in
      consumer preferences, or we may identify them later than our competitors
      do.&#160;&#160;In addition, any strategies we may implement to address these
      trends may prove excessively costly, incorrect or ineffective.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>We
      are dependent upon our existing credit facility including a term loan and
      revolver to finance our ongoing operations.&#160;&#160;</strong>There can be no
      assurances that this credit line will be sufficient to properly finance all
      working capital requirements and to adequately finance the required expenditures
      for new product launches and continued product development.&#160;&#160;This
      could result in losing market share in some markets and a reduction in
      revenues.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><u>Risks
      Involving Our Common Stock and Corporate Governance</u></strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>There
      is significant volatility in our stock prices</strong><em>.</em></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      market
      for our common stock is highly volatile.&#160;&#160;The trading price of our
      common stock could widely fluctuate in response to, among other
      things:</font></div>
    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">

            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">quarterly
                variations in our operating and financial
                results;</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>

            </td>

              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">announcements

                partnerships, joint ventures or capital
                commitments;</font></div>
            </td>

            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></font></div>
            </td>
