                of our common stock or other securities in the open market;
                and</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div>&#160;</div>
            </td>
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">other
                events or factors that may be beyond our
                control.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Statements
      or changes in opinions, ratings, or earnings estimates made by brokerage firms
      or industry analysts relating to the markets in which we conduct our business
      or
      relating to us or our competitors could result in an immediate and adverse
      effect on the market price of our common stock.&#160;&#160;In addition, the
      stock market has from time to time experienced extreme price and volume
      fluctuations which have particularly affected the market price for the
      securities of many companies which often have been unrelated to the operating
      performance of these companies.&#160;&#160;These broad market fluctuations may
      adversely affect the market price of our common stock.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>We
      may issue substantial amounts of additional shares of our common stock without
      shareholder approval, which could dilute the equity interests of our
      shareholders.</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">We
      have
      outstanding an aggregate of 17,928,800 shares of our common stock, as of the
      date of this prospectus.&#160;&#160;We also have 5 million shares of serial
      preferred stock authorized but unissued, all of which shares are not reserved
      for specific purposes, and an additional (a)1,394,400 shares of our common
      stock
      issuable upon the exercise of stock options granted or available for grant
      under
      our various stock plans, (b) 850,000 shares of our common stock issuable upon
      exercise of warrants we previously granted and are currently outstanding
      (including the 800,000 warrants held by certain of the selling security holders,
      the underlying shares for which are being offered pursuant to this prospectus),
      all as of the date of this prospectus and (c) 2,109,705 shares of our common
      stock issuable upon conversion of the initial principal amount of a convertible
      term note we previously issued, which shares are being offered pursuant to
      this
      prospectus, as of the date of this prospectus.&#160;&#160;All of such shares may
      be issued without any action or approval by our shareholders.&#160;&#160;Any
      shares issued by us in the future would further dilute the percentage ownership
      held by our shareholders.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">15</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Substantial
      sales of our common stock could adversely affect the market price of our common
      stock.</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Sales
      of a
      substantial number of shares of our common stock could adversely affect the
      market price of our common stock by introducing a large number of sellers to
      the
      market. This could cause the market price of our common stock to
      decline.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Our
      acquisition strategy may result in dilution to our
      shareholders</strong><em>.</em></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Our
      business strategy to increase our market share in the industries in which we
      compete includes the possibility of strategic acquisitions of other businesses,
      technologies and services.&#160;&#160;We anticipate that future acquisitions
      will require cash and issuances of our capital stock, including our common
      stock.&#160;&#160;To the extent we are required to pay cash for any acquisition,
      we anticipate that we would be required to obtain additional equity and/or
      debt
      financing.&#160;&#160;Equity financing would result in dilution for our then
      current shareholders.&#160;&#160;Such stock issuances and financing, if
      obtained, may not be on terms favorable to us and could result in substantial
      dilution to our shareholders at the time(s) of these stock issuances and
      financings.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>We
      have no history of paying dividends</strong><em>.</em></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">We
      have
      never paid any cash dividends on our common stock and we do not anticipate
      paying any dividends in the foreseeable future.&#160;&#160;In addition, if we do
      declare a dividend, the conversion price of the Term Loan with our secured
      credit facility would be reduced by an amount equal to the dividend declared
      and
      paid.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Limited
      directors&#8217; liability could prevent our shareholders from holding our directors
      responsible for a lack of care.</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Our
      certificate of incorporation provides that our directors will not be held liable
      to us or our shareholders for monetary damages upon breach of a directors&#8217;
fiduciary duty, except to the extent otherwise required by law.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><u>Item
      2.&#160;&#160;Properties</u></strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Our
      executive office and United States manufacturing facility is located in
      Elmsford, New York.&#160;&#160;This facility, which comprises approximately
      47,735 square feet, is subject to a lease expiring on December 31, 2009 with
      a
      current rental of $525,085 per year through the lease term, plus increases
      for
      real estate taxes, utility costs and common area charges.&#160;&#160;We believe
      our facility is well maintained, in good operating condition and sufficient
      to
      meet our present and anticipated needs.&#160;&#160;We have a manufacturing
      facility located in Verona, Italy.&#160;&#160;This facility, which comprises
      approximately 10,000 square feet, is subject to a lease expiring on November
      14,
      2015, with a current rental of Euro 83,160 plus VAT per year.&#160;&#160;We
      believe our facility is well maintained, and in good operating
      condition.&#160;&#160;We believe that we may have to expand this facility to
      meet expected demand for the three-dimensional CBCT equipment that is
      manufactured at this facility.&#160;&#160;We also maintain a small sales and
      marketing facility in Roswell, Georgia, which is subject to a lease expiring
      on
      May 31, 2009.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><u>Item
      3.&#160;&#160;Legal Proceedings</u></strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company is a defendant in an environmental claim relating to a property in
      New
      Jersey owned by the Company between August 1984 and June 1985.&#160;&#160;This
      claim relates to the offsite commercial disposition of trash and waste in a
      landfill in New Jersey.&#160;&#160;The Company maintains that its waste
      materials were of a general commercial nature. This claim was originally filed
      in 1998 by the federal government in United States District Court and the State
      of New Jersey, citing several hundred other third-party
      defendants.&#160;&#160;The Company (through its former subsidiary, Kenro
      Corporation) was added, along with many other defendants, to the
      suit.&#160;&#160;The Company's claimed liability was potentially assessed by the
      plaintiff at $150,000.&#160;&#160;The Company has joined, along with other
      involved defendants in an alternative dispute resolution (ADR) process for
      smaller claims.&#160;&#160;A recent settlement amount was offered by this group,
      however, to date, no settlement has been reached.&#160;&#160;The potential cost
      to the Company based on this settlement offer has been assessed at
      $18,080.&#160;&#160;The Company had accrued $11,550 as of Fiscal Year 2007 and
      Fiscal Year 2006, which represents the Company&#8217;s estimate of its potential
      liability, net of the Company&#8217;s insurance carrier&#8217;s agreed-upon contribution
      towards a potential settlement.&#160;&#160;The Company does not expect to
      receive any further information until a status conference is held in late
      November 2007.&#160;&#160;The Company cannot, at this time, assess the amount of
      liability that could result from any adverse final outcome of this environmental
      complaint. The Company's insurance carrier has agreed to equally share with
      the
      Company the defense costs incurred in this environmental claim.</font></div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">16</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">On
      February 8, 2005, the Company finalized a settlement relating to a separate
      environmental claim filed in 2001 as a civil complaint brought by the current
      owners of the same property owned by the Company between August 1984 and June
      1985.&#160;&#160;This action was filed in the Superior Court of New Jersey,
      Morris County, and alleged that the Company&#8217;s discontinued graphic art camera
      subsidiary had contaminated a portion of the site during its manufacturing
      process prior to 1985.&#160;&#160;The settlement included a release and
      indemnification as well as a stipulation of dismissal with
      prejudice.&#160;&#160;The Company paid $325,000 on February 18, 2005, which
      represented the Company&#8217;s entire liability under the settlement agreement, net
      of the Company&#8217;s insurance carrier&#8217;s contribution towards the total and final
      settlement.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">On
      October
      1, 2007, a settlement was reached in the product liability insurance action
      filed in May 2005 in the Superior Court in Hartford, Connecticut and later
      transferred to the United States District Court, District of Connecticut, in
      which the Company was a defendant (with several other parties).&#160;&#160;The
      plaintiff, through its insurance company, claimed that the Company&#8217;s equipment
      caused damages on the plaintiff&#8217;s premises in May 2003.&#160;&#160;The case was
      settled for less than the originally claimed amount and included mutual releases
      for all participating parties from any liability arising from the
      claim.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s insurance carrier was responsible for the
      settlement, and therefore there was no financial effect on the
      Company.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company is involved in two other product liability insurance actions, however,
      to date, no lawsuits have been filed.&#160;&#160;The Company maintains that its
      equipment was not the cause of the respective incidents or the resultant
      damage.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s insurance carriers, and their attorneys, are
      assisting in the Company&#8217;s defense in these matters.&#160;&#160;The Company does
      not believe that the final outcome of either of these matters will have a
      material adverse effect on the Company.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company was named as a third party defendant in a lawsuit which was filed in
      May
      2007 in the Supreme Court of Orange County, New York.&#160;&#160;The lawsuit
      alleges that the Company&#8217;s negligence in manufacturing, designing, assembling
      and distributing its digital radiographic sensors caused damages to the
      plaintiff.&#160;&#160;The entire complaint seeks $37,770 in
      damages.&#160;&#160;The Company believes its obligation is limited to less than
      $10,000, based on the specifics of the transaction.&#160;&#160;The Company has
      offered a full refund on this transaction and is awaiting the
      plaintiff&#160;&#160;and defendant to resolve their specific
      differences.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s attorneys, are assisting in the Company&#8217;s
      defense in this matter and are trying to finalize a mutually acceptable
      settlement with all concerned parties.&#160;&#160;The Company does not believe
      that the final outcome of this matter will have a material adverse effect on
      the
      Company.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">On
      August
      8, 2007, the Company received a letter from counsel to Lightyear Technology,
      Inc. that certain actions that the Company may have taken in regard to the
      acquisition of Lightyear, a small distribution channel, in December 2006, may
      give rise to causes of action including fraud and breach of
      contract.&#160;&#160;To date, no legal action has been filed.&#160;&#160;The
      Company believes it is currently in full compliance with the terms of the
      contract and maintains that there was neither fraud nor breach of
      contract.&#160;&#160;The Company believes that it acted in good faith at all
      times with the management and direction of Lightyear.&#160;&#160;At this time,
      the Company cannot assess if the final outcome of this matter will have a
      material adverse effect on the Company.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">From
      time
      to time, the Company may be party to other claims and litigation arising in
      the
      ordinary course of business.&#160;&#160;The Company does not believe that any
      adverse final outcome of any of these matters, whether covered by insurance
      or
      otherwise, would have a material adverse effect on the Company.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><u>Item
      4.&#160;&#160;Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security
      Holders</u></strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">There
      were
      no matters submitted to a vote of security holders during the fourth quarter
      of
      Fiscal Year 2007.</font></div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">17</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><u>Part
      II</u></strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><u>Item
      5.&#160;&#160;Market for the Registrant&#8217;s Common Equity and Related Stockholder
      Matters</u></strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Market
      Information</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company&#8217;s Common Stock, par value $.01 per share, is the only class of the
      Company&#8217;s common equity securities outstanding and is traded on the OTC Bulletin
      Board (Symbol &#8220;AFPC&#8221;), maintained by FINRA.&#160;&#160;The following table,
      based on information supplied by Commodity Systems Inc., shows the range of
      the
      closing high and low bid information for the Company&#8217;s Common Stock for each
      quarterly period during the Company&#8217;s last two fiscal years.&#160;&#160;These
      prices reflect inter-dealer prices and do not include retail mark-ups, markdowns
      or commissions, and may not represent actual transactions.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>

    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      market
      for the Company&#8217;s Common Stock is highly volatile and the trading price of the
      Common Stock could widely fluctuate in response to numerous
      factors.&#160;&#160;In addition, the stock market has from time to time
      experienced extreme price and volume fluctuations, which have particularly
      affected the market price for the securities of many companies, which often
      have
      been unrelated to the operating performance of these companies.&#160;&#160;These
      broad market fluctuations may adversely affect the market price of the Company&#8217;s
      Common Stock.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Holders</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">As
      of
      September 24, 2007 the closing bid price for the Company&#8217;s Common Stock, as
      reported on the OTC Bulletin Board, was $1.27, and there were 302 shareholders
      of record of the Common Stock.&#160;&#160;The Company estimates, based on
      surveys conducted by its transfer agent in connection with the Company&#8217;s 2006
      Annual Meeting of Shareholders, that there are approximately 1,100 beneficial
      holders of the Common Stock.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Dividends</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">No
      cash
      dividends have been declared on the Company&#8217;s Common Stock to date and the
      Company anticipates that any earnings will be retained for use in the Company&#8217;s
      business for the foreseeable future.&#160;&#160;The Board of Directors will have
      the sole discretion in determining whether to declare of pay dividends in the
      future.&#160;&#160;The declaration of dividends will depend on the
      profitability, financial condition, cash requirements, future prospects and
      other factors deemed relevant by the Board of Directors.&#160;&#160;In addition,
      provisions contained in the existing credit facility and financing arrangements
      with ComVest Capital, LLC places certain restrictions on the Company&#8217;s ability
      to declare and make any cash dividends.&#160;&#160;The Company currently does
      not have a set policy with respect to payment of dividends.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Securities
      Authorized for Issuance Under Equity Compensation Plans</strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      following table sets forth as of June 30, 2007:</font></div>

            <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="20%">
              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">Weighted

              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">price

                options, </font></div>
              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">warrants
                and rights</font></div>
            </td>
            <td width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
            <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="20%">
              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">Number
                of securities </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">remaining
                </font></div>
              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">available

                issuance under </font></div>

                securities reflected in column (a))</font></div>

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 54pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">(a)&#160;&#160;
                </font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Upon
                adoption of SFAS 142 in the first quarter of Fiscal Year 2003, the
                Company
                recorded a one-time, non-cash charge of approximately $1,297,069,
                to
                reduce the carrying value of its goodwill.&#160;&#160;Such charge is
                non-operational in nature and is reflected as a cumulative effect
                of an
                accounting change.&#160;&#160;See Note 1 to the Consolidated Financial
                Statements for further discussion and required
                disclosures.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 54pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">(b)&#160;&#160;
                </font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">On
                May 2, 2006, the Company issued 2,777,777 shares of its common stock
                in a
                private placement to selected institutional and other accredited
                investors.&#160;&#160;The offering price was at $1.80 per
                share.&#160;&#160;In conjunction with the private placement, the Company
                has granted the investors certain registration rights with respect
                to the
                resale of the shares acquired.&#160;&#160;The Company filed a registration
                statement which was declared effective on July 14, 2006.&#160;&#160;If
                this registration statement is subsequently suspended for a specified
                period of time, the Company could be required to pay a penalty of
                1% of
                the financing per month to the investors.&#160;&#160;Additionally, the
                Company is required to file amendments to the registration statement
                as
                necessary to keep the registration effective for 24 months from the
                closing date.&#160;&#160;In accordance with the provisions of FSP EITF
                00-19-2, the Company has classified this private placement in
                shareholders&#8217; equity on the accompanying consolidated balance sheets as of
                June 30, 2007.&#160;&#160;At June 30, 2006, the net proceeds were
                classified as temporary equity in accordance with the provisions
                of EITF
                Topic D-98.&#160;&#160;The Company has maintained this registration
                statement since it was declared effective and believes that any future
                payments related to this registration statement are
                remote.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">21</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 54pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">(c)&#160;&#160;
                </font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Includes
                the operating results of QR srl from April 19, 2007 to June 30,
                2007.&#160;&#160;On April 19, 2007, the Company completed the acquisition
                of Quantitative Radiology srl, an Italian corporation (&#8220;QR&#8221;), by acquiring
                all of the outstanding share capital of QR from the
                shareholders.&#160;&#160;QR is a global supplier of state-of-the-art,
                in-office three-dimensional dental computed tomography (CT).&#160;&#160;QR
                uses an imaging technology that features a cone shaped beam of x-rays
                (a
                CBCT scanner).&#160;&#160;The Company, prior to April 19, 2007, had acted
                as QR&#8217;s exclusive distributor in North and South America, excluding
                Brazil.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 54pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">(d)&#160;&#160;
                </font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
                acquisition of QR was accounted for under the purchase method of
                accounting in accordance with FASB Statement No. 141, Business
                Combinations (&#8220;SFAS 141&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The carrying values of QR&#8217;s assets
                and liabilities were adjusted to their fair values on April 19, 2007
                and
                the difference between the purchase price and the fair value of the
                net
                assets and liabilities was recorded as goodwill and other
                intangibles.&#160;&#160;Other intangibles include technology, customer
                lists and non-compete contracts and are being amortized over useful
                lives
                ranging from 5-10 years.&#160;&#160;Included in the results for fiscal
                year 2007 are (1) a charge to expense of $3,760,000 which represents
                the
                write-off of in process research and development acquired with the
                purchase of QR and (2) a charge to expense of $225,054 which represents
                the amortization of the intangibles associated with the acquisition
                of
                QR.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div><br>&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">22</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><u>Item
      7.&#160;&#160;Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and
      Results of Operation</u></strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      following should be read in conjunction with the Company&#8217;s Consolidated
      Financial Statements and notes thereto included elsewhere in this Annual Report
      on Form 10-K.&#160;&#160;This discussion may contain certain forward-looking
      statements based on current expectations that involve risks and
      uncertainties.&#160;&#160;Actual results and timing of certain events may differ
      significantly from those projected in such forward-looking statements due to
      a
      number of factors, including those set forth in elsewhere in this
      report.&#160;&#160;Except as otherwise disclosed, all amounts are reported in US
      dollars ($).</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><u>Capital
      Resources and Liquidity</u></strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company&#8217;s working capital at June 30, 2007 decreased by approximately $2.79
      million from June 30, 2006.&#160;&#160;This decrease is principally due to the
      acquisition of QR on April 19, 2007, which was funded through new debt,
      equity,&#160;&#160;and available cash resources.&#160;&#160;The Company assumed
      all of QR&#8217;s assets and liabilities as of such date.&#160;&#160;As of June 30,
      2006, the Company did not have any debt.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Operating
      cash flows were significantly lower in the 12 months ended June 2007 compared
      to
      June 2006 principally due to the loss from operations.&#160;&#160;This loss is
      mainly attributable to lower gross margins based on the product mix towards
      more
      distributor goods, the strong Euro in relation to the US dollar, increased
      competition in the marketplace, as well as significantly higher marketing,
      sales
      distribution and administrative expenses.&#160;&#160;These expenses related to
      new and existing products and the development and growth of various new
      distribution channels to advance sales growth.&#160;&#160;The Company also
      incurred approximately $1.56 million in transaction costs associated with the
      acquisition of QR.&#160;&#160;These factors caused the Company to utilize its
      cash resources, resulting in increased borrowings on the new credit
      facility.&#160;&#160;The Company is requiring advance deposits from its
      customers on the new-high dollar valued equipment, which is consistent with
      the
      vendor&#8217;s terms of sale.&#160;&#160;Otherwise, the Company has neither changed
      its payment policies to its vendors nor revised its payment terms with its
      customers.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      significant increase in current liabilities is mainly due to the current-portion
      of the newly-acquired debt, the assumption of QR&#8217;s current liabilities including
      accounts payable and accrued expenses.&#160;&#160;Current assets stayed
      relatively the same, however the significant increases in accounts receivable
      and inventory are mainly due the acquisition of QR, offset by the utilization
      of
      available cash in April 2007 towards the purchase price.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">On
      April
      12, 2007, the Company completed the sale of an aggregate of 5,500,000 shares
      of
      its common stock to certain accredited investors for an aggregate consideration
      of $8,140,000 pursuant to previously executed subscription
      agreements.&#160;&#160;The Company has granted the investors certain
      registration rights with respect to the resale of the shares
      acquired.&#160;&#160;The Company is subject to specific penalties if the
      registration statement is not filed within a certain time.&#160;&#160;The
      Company has received an extension of the time allowed to file this registration
      statement by the investors until October 15, 2007, so as to incorporate the
      information contained within this Annual Report on Form 10K.&#160;&#160;The
      Company believes that any payments of penalties related to this registration
      statement are remote.&#160;&#160;The common stock was issued and sold pursuant
      to the exemption from registration afforded by Regulation D of the Securities
      Act of 1933, as amended.&#160;&#160;In connection with the transaction, the
      Company paid the placement agent for the offering $407,000, or five percent
      of
      the gross proceeds of the offering.&#160;&#160;The net proceeds were used to
      fund a portion of the purchase price of QR srl, which was completed on April
      19,
      2007.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">On
      April
      13, 2007, the Company entered into a Revolving Credit and Term Loan Agreement
      with ComVest Capital, LLC whereby ComVest agreed to lend the Company an
      aggregate of up to $8 million in the form of a $5 million term loan and a $3
      million revolving loan facility.&#160;&#160;The term loan bears interest at a
      rate of ten percent (10%) per annum and provides for repayment over five years
      commencing in November 2007 in 53 equal monthly installments of $92,592.60
      with
      a final balloon payment of all remaining amounts due there-under on April 30,
      2012.&#160;&#160;The term loan is further subject to mandatory prepayment to the
      extent of 50% of proceeds received by the Company in connection with the sale
      of
      its capital stock unless such proceeds are utilized to acquire another
      business.&#160;&#160;The revolving loans bear interest a rate per annum of two
      percent (2%) plus the prime rate and is payable in full on April 30, 2012,
      has a
      specific formula to calculate available funds based on eligible accounts
      receivable and inventory, is subject to maximum &#8220;borrowing base&#8221; limitations,
      and has<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Helvetica, sans-serif;">&#160;</font>certain
      reporting requirements.&#160;&#160;This new senior secured Revolving Credit and
      Term Loan Agreement replaced the Company&#8217;s previous $2.5 million senior secured
      credit facility, which was due to expire on September 21, 2007.&#160;&#160;The
      proceeds were used to fund a portion of the purchase price of QR srl, which
      was
      completed on April 19, 2007 and for ongoing working capital
      requirements.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">As
      of June
      30, 2007, the Company was in compliance with all the terms and conditions of
      the
      Revolving Credit and Term Loan Agreement.</font></div>
    <div><br>&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">23</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Both
      loans
      are subject to mandatory prepayment in full in the event of certain &#8220;sale&#8221;
events, including merger, sale of assets or change in control.&#160;&#160;The
      term loan is convertible by ComVest at any time into shares of the Company&#8217;s
      common stock at a conversion price of $2.37 per share.&#160;&#160;The term loan
      is convertible at the Company&#8217;s option upon the satisfaction of certain
      conditions, including a reported trading price equal to 175% of the conversion
      price, the common stock being traded on NASDAQ, and a certain minimum trading
      volume, among others.&#160;&#160;In addition, the Company and each of its
      wholly-owned subsidiaries executed a Collateral Agreement pursuant to which
      each
      such party agreed to grant a security interest in all of its respective assets
      to ComVest as collateral security for repayment of the
      loans.&#160;&#160;Further, each subsidiary agreed to guaranty performance of all
      of the Company&#8217;s obligations to ComVest.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">As
      part of
      the transaction, the Company granted to ComVest an aggregate of 800,000 warrants
      to purchase shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock at exercise prices per share
      equal to $1.85 with respect to 266,666 warrants, $2.02 with respect to an
      additional 266,666 warrants, and $2.19 with respect to the remaining 266,668
      warrants.&#160;&#160;The Company entered into a Registration Rights Agreement
      pursuant to which it has agreed to register the shares of common stock issuable
      upon exercise of the warrants and conversion of the term note.&#160;&#160;The
      Company is subject to specific penalties if the registration statement is not
      filed within a certain time and then declared effective within a certain
      time.&#160;&#160;The Company must also use its best efforts to keep the
      registration statement effective during the applicable registration
      period.&#160;&#160;The Company has received an extension of the time allowed to
      file this registration statement from ComVest until October 15, 2007, so as
      to
      incorporate the information contained within this Annual Report on Form
      10K.&#160;&#160;The Company believes that any payments of penalties related to
      this registration statement are remote.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">On
      May 2,
      2006, the Company completed a private placement of its common stock to a group
      of institutional and other accredited investors.&#160;&#160;The Company sold a
      total of 2,777,777 shares of its common stock at $1.80 per share.&#160;&#160;The
      Company has granted the investors certain registration rights with respect
      to
      the resale of the shares acquired.&#160;&#160;The Company used the net proceeds
      to fund a portion of the purchase price of QR srl, which was completed on April
      19, 2007.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">With
      respect to the above described financing, the Company filed a registration
      statement which was declared effective on July 14, 2006.&#160;&#160;If this
      registration statement is subsequently suspended for a specified period of
      time,
      the Company could be required to pay a penalty of 1% of the financing per month
      to the investors.&#160;&#160;Additionally, the Company is required to file
      amendments to the registration statement as necessary to keep the registration
      effective for 24 months from the closing date.&#160;&#160;In accordance with the
      provisions of FSP EITF 00-19-2, the Company has reclassified this private
      placement from temporary equity to shareholders&#8217; equity on the accompanying
      balance sheets.&#160;&#160;The Company has maintained this registration
      statement since it was declared effective and believes that any future payments
      related to this registration statement are remote.&#160;&#160;Therefore, in
      accordance with SFAS 5, <em>Accounting for Contingencies, </em>no corresponding
      contingent liability has been recorded.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">In
      August
      and September 2006, the Company&#8217;s former senior secured lender chose to exercise
      its warrant to purchase 100,000 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock by
      converting the warrant into 82,806 shares of common stock in a cashless exercise
      in a manner as specified in the warrant.&#160;&#160;This warrant was due to
      expire in September 2006.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Capital
      expenditures for Fiscal Year 2007 were approximately $251,200, consisting of
      the
      purchase of demonstration equipment to properly display the Company&#8217;s equipment
      to potential customers, the purchase of several new high-end sales demonstration
      computers, an additional module for the Customer Relationship Management system,
      a sales tax module, improvements to the Company&#8217;s existing network, and tooling
      expenditures related to the redesign, development and production of new imaging
      products.&#160;&#160;Most of the capital expenditures were from the operations
      in the United States.&#160;&#160;The Company expects to continue to finance any
      future capital requirements principally from internally generated
      funds.&#160;&#160;The total amount of capital expenditures is not limited under
      the Company&#8217;s new Revolving Credit and Term Loan Agreement</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company&#8217;s historical operating cash flows generally have been positive; however,
      the Company is dependent upon its Revolving Credit and Term Loan Agreement
      with
      ComVest to finance its ongoing operations.&#160;&#160;The Company expects its
      worldwide working capital requirements will continue to be financed by
      operations, both in the United States and Italy, and from borrowings on the
      Revolving Credit and Term Loan Agreement.&#160;&#160;It is believed that the
      Revolving Credit and Term Loan Agreement is sufficient to finance the Company&#8217;s
      ongoing worldwide working capital requirements for the foreseeable
      future.&#160;&#160;The Company currently believes that there are no significant
      trends, demands, commitments or contingencies, other than an unexpected material
      adverse conclusion to an ongoing environmental litigation case, or any other
      pending litigation, which are reasonably likely to result in a significant
      increase or decrease in its liquidity or capital resources within the
      foreseeable near-term future. As of June 30, 2007, the Company had available
      approximately $575,286 of unused credit under the Revolving Credit and Term
      Loan
      Agreement.&#160;&#160;As of September 15, 2007, the Company had available
      approximately $443,324 of unused credit under the Revolving Credit and Term
      Loan
      Agreement.&#160;&#160;No assurances can be given that the Company will have
      sufficient cash flow in the long term.</font></div>
    <div><br>&#160;</div>
    <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
      <div id="FTR">
        <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">24</font></div>
        <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
          <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
        </div>
      </div>
      <div id="HDR">
        <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company&#8217;s Italian subsidiary has the ability to borrow up to 350,000 Euros under
      two separate lines of credit, and up to an additional one million Euros from
      three different lines, all guaranteed by its accounts receivable and
      inventory.&#160;&#160;All the lines are with two different financial
      institutions.&#160;&#160;These lines of credit were granted in August 2007 for
      working capital purposes, and no funds were outstanding as of June 30,
      2007.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company is continuing to investigate various strategies to increase its market
      share.&#160;&#160;Some of these strategies could involve the acquisition of one
      or more businesses or product line distributions.&#160;&#160;There are no
      assurances that the Company will be able to identify any suitable acquisition
      candidate(s), or, if so identified, be able to enter into a definitive agreement
      with such candidates on terms favorable to the Company.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><u>Off-Balance
      Sheet Arrangements</u></strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company has no off-balance sheet financing arrangements or interests in
      so-called special purpose entities.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><u>Results
      of Operations</u></strong></font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      results of operations for the Company have changed significantly as a result
      of
      the acquisition of QR on April 19, 2007.&#160;&#160;QR, located in Verona, Italy
      is a global supplier of state-of-the-art, in-office three-dimensional dental
      computed tomography (CT).&#160;&#160;QR uses an imaging technology that features
      a cone shaped beam of x-rays (a CBCT scanner).&#160;&#160;The carrying values of
      QR&#8217;s assets and liabilities were adjusted to their fair values and the
      difference between the purchase price and the fair value of the net assets
      was
      recorded as goodwill and other intangibles, and is subject to periodic
      impairment testing.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s results of operations have been and
      will continue to be materially effected by the amortization costs associated
      with these other intangibles.</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
      Company&#8217;s operating results have varied in the past and are likely to vary in
      the future.&#160;&#160;Due to variations that the Company has experienced in
      operating results, management does not believe that period-to-period comparisons
      of results of operations are necessarily meaningful or reliable as indicators
      of
      future performance.&#160;&#160;These variations result from several factors,
      many of which many of which are not in the Company&#8217;s control, including but not
      limited to:</font></div>
    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div>&#160;</div>
            </td>
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Wingdings">&#167;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Changes
                in technology, specifically imaging
                modalities,</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div>&#160;</div>
            </td>
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;</font></font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Demand
                for products and services,</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>

            <td>
              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
                level of product, price and service
                competition,</font></div>
            </td>

              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;</font></font></div>

            <td>
              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Changes

                margins,</font></div>

              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;</font></font></div>

              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline;" face="Symbol, serif">&#183;</font></font></div>

            <td>
              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The

    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div>&#160;</div>
