                  <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: white 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="64%" style="BORDER-LEFT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">Cashless
                      exercise of common stock warrants</font></div>
                  </td>
                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$</font></td>
                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">19,800</font></div>
                  </td>
                  <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">-</font></div>
                  </td>
                  <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">-</font></div>
                  </td>
                  <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="64%" style="BORDER-LEFT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: white 2px solid">
                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">Issuance
                      of 800,000 warrants in connection with</font></div>
                  </td>
                  <td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: white 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: white 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: white 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: white 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: white 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: white 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: white 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: white 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: white 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: white 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: white 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: white 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                </tr>
                <tr>
                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="64%" style="BORDER-LEFT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;the
                      new debt issuance</font></div>
                  </td>
                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$</font></td>
                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">1,114,784</font></div>
                  </td>
                  <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">-</font></div>
                  </td>
                  <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                  <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">-</font></div>
                  </td>
                  <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                </tr>

            </table>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">See
          Notes
          to Consolidated Financial Statements</font>&#160;</div>
      </div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">F-5</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>AFP
          IMAGING CORPORATION AND SUBSIDIARIES</strong></font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>NOTES
          TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</strong></font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>JUNE
          30, 2007</strong></font></div>
        <hr style="COLOR: black" align="left" noshade size="4" width="100%">
      </div>
      <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>1.&#160;&#160;&#160;NATURE
        OF BUSINESS AND SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES</strong><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">:</font></font><br><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">AFP
        Imaging Corporation, together with its subsidiaries (the "Company"), was
        organized on September 20, 1978 under the laws of the State of New
        York.&#160;&#160;The Company is engaged in the business of designing,
        developing, manufacturing and distributing equipment for generating, capturing
        and/or producing dental, veterinary and medical diagnostic images through
        digital imaging technologies as well as the chemical processing of
        photosensitive materials.&#160;&#160;These products are used by medical, dental,
        veterinary and industrial professionals.&#160;&#160;The Company's products are
        sold and distributed to worldwide markets, under various brand names, through
        a
        network of independent and unaffiliated dealers and independent sales
        representatives.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">On
        April
        19, 2007, the Company completed the acquisition of Quantitative Radiology
        srl,
        an Italian corporation (&#8220;QR&#8221;), by acquiring all of the outstanding share capital
        of QR from the shareholders.&#160;&#160;QR is a global supplier of
        state-of-the-art, in-office three-dimensional dental computed tomography
        (CT).&#160;&#160;QR uses an imaging technology that features a cone shaped beam
        of x-rays (a CBCT scanner).&#160;&#160;The Company, prior to April 19, 2007, had
        acted as QR&#8217;s exclusive distributor in North and South America, excluding
        Brazil.&#160;&#160;Funding for the acquisition was principally derived from two
        sources; the first was the proceeds raised from a private offering of the
        Company&#8217;s common stock to equity investors and the second was the loan proceeds
        from ComVest Capital, LLC in connection with a term loan and revolving credit
        facility.&#160;&#160;In connection with the acquisition, the Company, entered
        into employment agreements with each of the former shareholders&#8217; of
        QR.&#160;&#160;Each agreement contains a non-compete clause which prohibits the
        employee from engaging in activities competitive with the business of QR
        for a
        period of five years from the date of termination of employment.<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: LinePrinter, monospace;">&#160;</font></font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">On
        April
        12, 2007, the Company completed the sale of an aggregate of 5,500,000 shares
        of
        its common stock to certain accredited investors for an aggregate consideration
        of $8,140,000 pursuant to previously executed subscription
        agreements.&#160;&#160;The common stock was issued and sold pursuant to the
        exemption from registration afforded by regulation D of the Securities Act
        of
        1933, as amended.&#160;&#160;In connection with the transaction, the Company
        paid the placement agent for the offering $407,000, or five percent of the
        gross
        proceeds of the offering.&#160;&#160;The proceeds were used for the purchase of
        QR.&#160;&#160;The Company has granted the investors certain registration rights
        with respect to the resale of the shares acquired and agreed to register
        these
        shares of common stock.&#160;&#160;The Company is subject to specific penalties
        if the registration statement is not filed within a certain time.&#160;&#160;The
        Company has received an extension of time allowed to file this registration
        statement from the investors until October 15, 2007, so as to incorporate
        the
        information contained within this Annual Report on Form 10K<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: LinePrinter, monospace;">.&#160;&#160;</font>The
        Company believes that any payments of penalties related to this registration
        statement are remote.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">On
        April
        13, 2007, the Company entered into a Revolving Credit and Term Loan Agreement
        with ComVest Capital, LLC (&#8220;ComVest&#8221;) whereby ComVest agreed to lend the Company
        an aggregate of up to $8 million in the form of a $5 million term loan and
        a $3
        million revolving loan facility.&#160;&#160;The term loan bears interest at a
        rate of ten percent (10%) per annum and provides for repayment over five
        years
        commencing in November 2007; and the revolving loans bear interest at a rate
        per
        annum of two percent (2%) plus the prime rate and is payable in full on April
        30, 2012.&#160;&#160;The Company and each of its wholly-owned subsidiaries
        executed a Collateral Agreement pursuant to which each such party agreed
        to
        grant a security interest in all of its respective assets to ComVest as
        collateral security for repayment of the loans.&#160;&#160;This new senior
        secured Revolving Credit and Term Loan Agreement replaced the Company&#8217;s previous
        $2.5 million senior secured credit facility, which was due to expire on
        September 21, 2007.&#160;&#160;As part of the transaction, the Company granted
        to ComVest an aggregate of 800,000 warrants to purchase shares of the Company&#8217;s
        common stock at exercise prices per share equal to $1.85 with respect to
        266,666
        warrants, $2.02 with respect to an additional 266,666 warrants, and $2.19
        with
        respect to the remaining 266,668 warrants.&#160;&#160;The Company entered into a
        Registration Rights Agreement pursuant to which it has agreed to register
        the
        shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of the warrants and conversion
        of
        the term note.&#160;&#160;The Company is subject to specific penalties if the
        registration statement is not filed within a certain time and then declared
        effective within a certain time.&#160;&#160;The Company must also use its best
        efforts to keep the registration statement effective during the applicable
        registration period.&#160;&#160;The Company has received an extension of the
        time allowed to file this registration statement from ComVest until October
        15,
        2007, so as to incorporate the information contained within this Annual Report
        on Form 10K.&#160;&#160;The Company believes that any payments of penalties
        related to this registration statement are remote<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: LinePrinter, monospace;">.</font></font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        consolidated financial statements include AFP Imaging Corporation and its
        wholly
        owned subsidiaries.&#160;&#160;All significant intercompany transactions have
        been eliminated in consolidation.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">F-6</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        preparation of financial statements in conformity with United States generally
        accepted accounting principles requires management to make estimates and
        assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and
        the
        reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting
        period.&#160;&#160;Actual results could differ from those
        estimates.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Revenue
        is
        recognized by the Company when products are shipped and title passes to the
        customer.&#160;&#160;The Company includes shipping and handling costs as a
        component of cost of sales.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Cash
        and
        cash equivalents include deposits with original maturities of three months
        or
        less.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        Company maintains cash in bank deposit accounts which, at times, exceed
        federally insured limits.&#160;&#160;The Company has not experienced any losses
        on these accounts.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Inventories,
        which include material, labor and manufacturing overhead, are stated at the
        lower of cost (first-in, first-out) or market (net realizable
        value).</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Machinery
        and equipment are depreciated using straight-line and accelerated methods
        over
        their estimated useful lives, ranging from three to ten
        years.&#160;&#160;Leasehold improvements are depreciated on a straight-line
        basis over the shorter of their estimated useful lives or the term of the
        lease.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Research
        and development costs are charged to expense as incurred.&#160;&#160;These costs
        are incurred in connection with the design and development of the Company's
        new
        or enhanced products.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Advertising
        costs, included in selling, general and administrative costs, are charged
        to
        expense as incurred and were approximately $322,500, $287,600 and $185,300
        for
        the fiscal years ended June 30, 2007, 2006 and 2005, respectively.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Effective
        July 1, 2005, the Company adopted the fair value based method of accounting
        for
        stock-based employee compensation under the provisions of Statement of Financial
        Accounting Standards No. 123 (Revised 2004), <em>Share Based Payment</em> (&#8220;SFAS
        No. 123R&#8221;), using the modified prospective method without restatement of the
        periods prior to the adoption date, as described in SFAS 123R.&#160;&#160;The
        share based compensation cost will be measured based on the fair value of
        the
        equity or liability instruments issued.&#160;&#160;SFAS No. 123R also requires
        the benefits of tax deductions in excess of recognized compensation cost
        to be
        reported as a financing cash flow rather than as an operating cash flow as
        required under prior literature.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">As
        a
        result, the Company has begun recognizing expense in an amount equal to the
        fair
        value of share-based payments (including stock option awards) on their date
        of
        grant, over the vesting period of the awards.&#160;&#160;Under SFAS 123R, the
        Company must recognize compensation expense for (1) all share-based payments
        granted on or after July 1, 2005 and (2) any partially vested options as
        of July
        1, 2005.&#160;&#160;Prior to the adoption of SFAS 123R, the Company accounted
        for these plans pursuant to Accounting Principles Board Opinion No. 25
<em>Accounting for Stock Issued to Employees</em>.&#160;&#160;Therefore,
        compensation expense related to stock option awards was not reflected in
        operating expenses in any period prior to July 2005 (first quarter of Fiscal
        Year 2006), and prior period results have not been restated.&#160;&#160;For the
        twelve months ended June 30, 2007 and June 30, 2006, non-cash stock based
        compensation expense related to stock option awards (&#8220;Stock Option Expense&#8221;) was
        $82,461 and $82,398, respectively, and have been included in selling, general
        and administrative expenses.&#160;&#160;The compensation expense did not result
        in a tax benefit as a result of the valuation allowance applied to the related
        deferred tax asset.&#160;&#160;For the twelve months ended June 30, 2005 had the
        Company adopted the fair value based method of accounting for stock-based
        compensation under the provisions of SFAS 123R, Stock Option Expense would
        have
        been $151,884, and the effect on the Company&#8217;s net income and net income per
        share would approximate the pro forma amounts shown in the following
        table:</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div>
        <div align="center">

                    30,</strong></font></div>
                </td>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-TOP: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>

      </div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">F-7</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        Company translates the assets and liabilities of its foreign subsidiaries
        into
        US dollars at the closing balance sheet rate of exchange.&#160;&#160;Income and
        cash flow statements are translated at the average rates of exchange for
        the
        period.&#160;&#160;Gains and loses from translating the financial statements of
        the foreign operations where the functional currency is not the US dollar
        is
        included in Foreign Currency Translation Adjustment within Shareholders&#8217;
Equity.&#160;&#160;The functional currency for the Company&#8217;s foreign
        subsidiaries is the local currency.&#160;&#160;The Company did not have any
        foreign operations for the fiscal years ended June 2006 and 2005.&#160;&#160;Any
        exchange rate differences arising at the time of collection of
        accounts&#160;&#160;receivables or settlement of accounts payable are included
        in net income.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">In
        addition to net income (loss), comprehensive income (loss) includes other
        charges or credits to equity other than those resulting from transactions
        with
        shareholders.&#160;&#160;Comprehensive income/ (loss) relates to foreign
        currency translation adjustments related to the Company&#8217;s foreign
        subsidiaries.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Accounts
        receivable are recorded at the invoiced amount and do not bear
        interest.&#160;&#160;The allowance for doubtful accounts is the Company's best
        estimate of the amount of probable credit losses in the Company's existing
        accounts receivable.&#160;&#160;The Company establishes an allowance for
        doubtful accounts based upon factors surrounding the credit risk of specific
        customers, historical trends and other information.&#160;&#160;Receivable
        balances are reviewed on an aged basis and account balances are charged off
        against the allowance after all means of collection have been exhausted and
        the
        potential for recovery is doubtful.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        Company purchased a Euro hedge contract in March 2007 to limit the Company&#8217;s
        foreign currency exchange risk associated with the purchase of QR on April
        19,
        2007, as the purchase price was in Euro.&#160;&#160;The Company realized a gain
        of $352,966 which is included in the accompanying consolidated statement
        of
        operations.&#160;&#160;In accordance with FASB Statement No. 133 (&#8220;SFAS 133&#8221;),
        Accounting for Derivative Instruments and Hedging Activities, the off-setting
        gain has been recorded as part of the transaction costs associated with the
        purchase of QR.&#160;&#160;This derivative financial instrument has been
        designated a fair value hedge and is deemed to be completely
        effective.&#160;&#160;There were no derivative financial instruments outstanding
        as of June 30, 2007.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Prior
        to
        April 2007, the Company did not have any long-lived assets or
        goodwill.&#160;&#160;Long-lived assets held for use by the Company will be
        reviewed for impairment whenever circumstances provide evidence that suggests
        the carrying amount of the asset may not be recoverable.&#160;&#160;The Company
        will also perform ongoing impairment analysis on intangible assets related
        to
        technology.&#160;&#160;Determination of whether impairment exists will be based
        upon comparison of the identifiable cash flows of the assets to the carrying
        values of the respective assets, and if impaired the value of the asset will
        be
        reduced.&#160;&#160;Goodwill is not amortized, but will be tested for impairment
        on an annual basis each June 30<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;"><sup>th</sup></font>, or whenever
        circumstances or events indicate that the carrying amount may not be
        recoverable.&#160;&#160;The impairment tests will be based on a comparison of
        the fair value of the reporting entity to the respective goodwill
        amount.&#160;&#160;Any identified impairment will result in a charge to reduce
        the carrying value of the associated goodwill.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Income
        taxes are accounted for under the asset and liability
        method.&#160;&#160;Deferred tax assets and liabilities are recognized for the
        estimated future tax consequences attributable to differences between the
        financial statement carrying amounts of existing assets and liabilities and
        their respective tax bases and operating loss carryforwards.&#160;&#160;Deferred
        tax assets and liabilities are measured using enacted tax rates in effect
        for
        the year in which those temporary differences are expected to be recovered
        or
        settled.&#160;&#160;The effect on deferred tax assets and liabilities of a
        change in tax rates is recognized in income in the period that includes the
        enactment date.&#160;&#160;The Company records a valuation allowance to reduce
        its deferred tax asset to an amount that is more likely than not to be
        realized.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        Company&#8217;s basic net income per common share is based upon the weighted-average
        number of common shares outstanding during the period.&#160;&#160;Diluted net
        income per share is based upon the weighted average number of common shares
        and
        common share equivalents outstanding when conversion would cause
        dilution.&#160;&#160;Common share equivalents include (1) outstanding stock
        options and (2) outstanding warrants.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Basic
        and
        diluted income per common share for the fiscal years ended 2007, 2006 and
        2005
        is presented below:</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">F-8</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">

      <div>
        <div align="center">
          <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="90%">

              <tr>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="55%" style="BORDER-LEFT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>June
                    30,</strong></font></div>
                </td>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                <td align="left" colspan="2" valign="bottom" width="13%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>2007</strong></font></div>
                </td>
                <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                <td align="left" colspan="2" valign="bottom" width="13%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>2006</strong></font></div>
                </td>
                <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>

                </td>
                <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-RIGHT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: white 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              </tr>
              <tr>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="55%" style="BORDER-LEFT: medium none; BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;Dilutive
                    effect of warrants</font></div>
                </td>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="12%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                  <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">---</font></div>
                </td>
                <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
                <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>

          </table>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        diluted income per common share computation reflects the effect of common
        shares
        contingently issuable upon the exercise of warrants and options in periods
        in
        which conversion would cause dilution.&#160;&#160;The diluted weighted-average
        number of shares outstanding for the years ended June 30, 2007, 2006, and
        2005
        does not include the potential exercise of the following stock options and
        warrants as such amounts were antidilutive,</font></div>
      <div><br></div>

              <td align="justify" valign="top" width="40%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">

              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="20%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">10,000</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="20%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">18,000</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">On
        May 2,
        2006, the Company issued 2,777,777 shares of its common stock in a private
        placement to selected institutional and other accredited
        investors.&#160;&#160;The offering price was at $1.80 per share.&#160;&#160;In
        conjunction with the private placement, the Company has granted the investors
        certain registration rights with respect to the resale of the shares
        acquired.&#160;&#160;No warrants were issued to the investors in this private
        placement.&#160;&#160;The Company incurred fees of approximately $256,000
        including all placement fees and related legal and accounting
        expenses.&#160;&#160;The Company used the entire net proceeds for the
        acquisition of QR on April 19, 2007.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">With
        respect to the above described financing, the Company filed a registration
        statement which was declared effective on July 14, 2006.&#160;&#160;If this
        registration statement is subsequently suspended for a specified period of
        time,
        the Company could be required to pay a penalty of 1% of the financing per
        month
        to the investors.&#160;&#160;Additionally, the Company is required to file
        amendments to the registration statement as necessary to keep the registration
        effective for 24 months from the closing date. In accordance with the provisions
        of FSP EITF 00-19-2, the Company has reclassified this private placement
        from
        temporary equity to shareholders&#8217; equity on the accompanying balance sheet as of
        June 30, 2007.&#160;&#160;At June 30, 2006, the net proceeds were classified as
        temporary equity in accordance with the provisions of EITF Topic
        D-98.&#160;&#160;The Company has maintained this registration statement since it
        was declared effective and believes that any future payments related to this
        registration statement are remote.&#160;&#160;Therefore, in accordance with SFAS
        5, <em>Accounting for Contingencies, </em>no corresponding contingent liability
        has been recorded.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">On
        March
        28, 2006, the Company issued an aggregate of 50,000 warrants to designees
        of an
        investment banking firm.&#160;&#160;Each warrant entitles the holder to purchase
        one share of common stock at a purchase price of $1.98, the closing stock
        price
        on March 28, 2006.&#160;&#160;The warrants are for five years and the
        Black-Scholes method was used to value these warrants.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">In
        August
        and September 2006, the Company&#8217;s previous senior secured lender chose to
        exercise its warrant to purchase 100,000 shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock
        into 82,806 shares of common stock in a cashless exercise in a manner as
        specified in the warrant.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">In
        February 2006, the FASB issued SFAS No. 155, <em>Accounting for Certain Hybrid
        Financial Instruments &#8211; an amendment of FASB Statements No. 133 and 140</em>
        (&#8220;SFAS No. 155&#8221;).&#160;&#160;This statement improves financial reporting by
        allowing fair value measurement for hybrid financial instruments that contain
        an
        embedded derivative as well as clarifying certain points of SFAS No. 133
        and
        SFAS No. 140.&#160;&#160;SFAS No. 155 is effective for all financial instruments
        acquired or issued in fiscal years beginning after September 15,
        2006.&#160;&#160;In March 2006, the FASB issued SFAS No. 156, <em>Accounting for
        Servicing of Financial Assets &#8211; an amendment of FASB Statement No. 140</em>
        (&#8220;SFAS No. 156&#8221;).&#160;&#160;This statement requires that all separately
        recognized servicing assets and liabilities be initially measured at fair
        value
        if practicable and clarifies certain points of SFAS140.&#160;&#160;SFAS No. 156
        is effective for fiscal years that begin after September 15,
        2006.&#160;&#160;The Company does not believe that SFAS Nos. 155 and 156 will
        have any material effect on the Company&#8217;s financial statements or results of
        operations.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">F-9</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">In
        July
        2006, the FASB issued FASB Interpretation No. 48, <em>Accounting for Uncertainty
        in Income Taxes, an interpretation of FASB No. 109 </em>(&#8220;FIN 48&#8221;), which
        provides criteria for the recognition, measurement, presentation and disclosure
        of uncertain tax positions.&#160;&#160;A tax benefit from an uncertain position
        may be recognized only if it is &#8220;more likely than not&#8221; that the position is
        sustainable based on its technical merits.&#160;&#160;The provisions of FIN 48
        are effective for fiscal years beginning after December 15, 2006.&#160;&#160;We
        do not expect FIN 48 will have a material effect on the Company&#8217;s financial
        statements.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">In
        September 2006, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (&#8220;FASB&#8221;) issued SFAS
        No. 157, <em>Fair Value Measurements </em>(&#8220;SFAS No. 157&#8221;).&#160;&#160;SFAS No.
        157 establishes a framework for measuring fair value in generally accepted
        accounting principles and expands disclosures about fair value
        measurements.&#160;&#160;SFAS No. 157 emphasizes that fair value is a
        market-based measurement, not an entity-specific measurement.&#160;&#160;SFAS
        No. 157 also expands disclosures about the use of fair value to measure assets
        and liabilities in interim and annual periods subsequent to initial
        recognition.&#160;&#160;The Company is required to adopt SFAS No. 157, as
        applicable, beginning in July 2008.&#160;&#160;The Company is evaluating the
        effect of SFAS No. 157, but does not believe that there will be any material
        effect on the Company&#8217;s financial statements.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">In
        September 2006, the FASB also issued SFAS No. 158, <em>Employers&#8217; Accounting for
        Defined Benefit Pension and Other Postretirement Plans-an Amendment of FASB
        Statements No. 87, 88, 106 and 132R </em>(&#8220;SFAS No. 158&#8221;).&#160;&#160;SFAS No.
        158 improves financial reporting by requiring an employer to recognize the
        over
        funded or under funded status of a defined benefit postretirement plan as
        an
        asset or liability in its statement of financial position and to recognize
        changes in that funded status in the year in which the changes occur through
        comprehensive income of a business entity or changes in unrestricted net
        assets
        of a not-for-profit organization.&#160;&#160;SFAS No. 158 also improves
        financial reporting by requiring an employer to measure the funded status
        of a
        plan as of the date of its year-end financial position.&#160;&#160;The Company
        is required to adopt SFAS No. 158, as applicable, as follows.&#160;&#160;The
        Company must recognize the funded status of its defined benefit postretirement
        plans and provide the required disclosures as of June 30, 2007, and the Company
        must measure the plan assets and benefit obligations for the fiscal year
        ended
        June 30, 2009.&#160;&#160;The Company does not believe that there will be any
        material effect on the Company&#8217;s financial statements.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">In
        December 2006, the FASB issued FSP EITF 00-19-2, <em>Accounting for Registration
        Payment Arrangements </em>(&#8220;FSP EITF 00-19-2&#8221;).&#160;&#160;FSP EITF 00-19-2
        addresses an issuer&#8217;s accounting for registration payment arrangements, and
        specifies that the contingent obligation to make future payments or otherwise
        transfer consideration under a registration payment arrangement should be
        separately recognized and measured in accordance with SFAS No. 5, <em>Accounting
        for Contingencies.</em>&#160;&#160;The Company adopted FSP EITF 00-19-2
        effective January 1, 2007.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">In
        February 2007, the FASB issued SFAS
        No. 159, </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;"><em>The Fair Value
        Option for Financial Assets and Financial Liabilities &#8211; Including an Amendment
        of FASB Statement No. 115 </em></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">(&#8220;SFAS No. 159&#8221;)</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;"><em>.&#160;&#160;</em></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">SFAS
        159 permits entities to choose to
        measure many financial instruments and certain other items at fair value,
        so as
        to improve financial reporting by providing entities with the opportunity
        to
        alleviate volatility in reported earnings.&#160;&#160;This Statement should
        expand the use of fair value measurement and permits all entities to choose
        to
        measure eligible items at fair value at specified election dates.&#160;&#160;The
        resulting unrealized gains or losses on items which the fair value option
        has
        been elected are to be reported in earnings.&#160;&#160;The Company is required
        to adopt SFAS No. 159, as applicable, beginning in July 2008.&#160;&#160;The
        Company is evaluating the effect of SFAS No. 159, but does not believe that
        there will be any material effect on the Company&#8217;s financial
        statements</font>.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Management
        does not believe that any other recently issued, but not yet effective,
        accounting standards if currently adopted would have a material effect on
        the
        accompanying consolidated financial statements.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div>
        <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

              </td>

              </td>
            </tr>

        the following</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif;">:</font></font></div>

      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Inventories,
        which include material and a small component of labor and manufacturing
        overhead, are stated at the lower of cost (first-in, first-out) or market
        (net
        realizable value).&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s US operations uses a standard cost
        accounting system in conjunction with an actual perpetual inventory system
        to
        properly account for, control and maintain the movement of all inventory
        components.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s foreign operations evaluated various
        inventory control systems, and implemented such in early fiscal year
        2008.&#160;&#160;Provision has been made for any potential losses on obsolete or
        slow-moving inventory items.</font></div>

        equipment which is on consignment with customers is valued at the costs
        described above, reduced for reductions in value in view of its technical
        obsolescence, over periods up to five years.</font></div>

              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">(1,602,121</font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">)</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">(1,450,484</font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">)</font></td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td align="justify" valign="bottom" width="76%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Property
                  and equipment, net</strong></font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">539,002</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">377,665</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Depreciation
        and amortization was $253,402, $216,179 and $176,514 for the years ended
        June
        30, 2007, 2006 and 2005, respectively.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 36pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        Company retired $101,763 and $56,749 of assets during fiscal years 2007 and
        2005, respectively, and did not retire any assets during fiscal year
        2006.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div>
        <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

            <tr valign="top">
              <td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>4.</strong></font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>DEBT:</strong></font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">On
        April
        13, 2007, the Company entered into a new senior secured credit facility (the
        Revolving Credit and Term Loan) with ComVest Capital, LLC that replaced the
        Company&#8217;s existing $2.5 million revolving line of credit that was due to expire
        on September 21, 2007.&#160;&#160;The Revolving Credit and Term Loan consists of
        a $5 million convertible term note and a $3 million revolving loan
        facility.&#160;&#160;The convertible term note bears interest at a rate of ten
        percent per annum and provides for repayment over five years commencing in
        November 2007 with a final balloon payment of all remaining amounts due
        there-under on April 30, 2012.&#160;&#160;The revolving loan bears interest at a
        rate of two percent plus prime rate per annum, currently equal to 9.75%,
        has a
        specific formula to calculate available funds based on eligible accounts
        receivable and inventory, is subject to certain maximum borrowing base
        requirements, has certain reporting requirements to the lender, and is payable
        in full on April 12, 2012.&#160;&#160;The convertible term note, in addition to
        being convertible by the Company upon the satisfaction of certain conditions,
        including a trading price equal to 175% of the conversion price and the
        Company&#8217;s common stock being traded on Nasdaq, is convertible by the lender at
        any time into shares of common stock at a conversion price of $2.37 per share,
        or 2,109,705 shares based on the initial principal amount of the convertible
        term note.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        Company and each of its wholly-owned subsidiaries executed a Collateral
        Agreement pursuant to which each such party agreed to grant a security interest
        in all of its respective assets to ComVest as collateral security for repayment
        of the loans.&#160;&#160;The Revolving Credit and Term Loan is secured by all of
        our and our wholly-owned subsidiaries inventory, accounts receivable, equipment,
        officer life insurance policies and proceeds thereof, trademarks, licenses,
        patents and general intangibles.&#160;&#160;It is believed that the Revolving
        Credit and Term Loan is sufficient to finance our ongoing working capital
        requirements for the foreseeable future.&#160;&#160;The Revolving Credit and
        Term Loan Agreement has a specific formula to calculate available funds based
        on
        eligible accounts receivable and inventory, is subject to maximum borrowing
        base
        limitations, and has certain reporting requirements.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">As
        part of
        the transaction, the Company granted to ComVest an aggregate of 800,000,
        five-year warrants to purchase shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock at exercise
        prices per share equal to $1.85 with respect to 266,666 warrants, $2.02 with
        respect to an additional 266,666 warrants, and $2.19 with respect to the
        remaining 266,668 warrants. The Company has assessed whether the warrants
        granted to ComVest should be classified as either a liability or equity in
        accordance with EITF 00-19, &#8220;<em>Accounting for Derivative Financial Instruments
        Indexed to, and Potentially Settled in a Company&#8217;s Own Stock</em>&#8221; and concluded
        that these warrants should be classified as equity.&#160;&#160;The Black-Scholes
        Method was used to value these detachable warrants, and have been recorded
        in
        the accompanying Consolidated Balance Sheets at $1,114,784.&#160;&#160;The
        Company entered into a Registration Rights Agreement pursuant to which it
        has
        agreed to register the shares of common stock issuable upon exercise of the
        warrants and conversion of the term note.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">.In
        accordance with Accounting principles Board Opinion No. 14, &#8220;<em>Accounting for
        Convertible Debt and Debt Issued with Stock Purchase warrants</em>&#8221;, proceeds
        received from the sale of debt with detachable stock purchase warrants are
        allocated to both the debt and the warrants.&#160;&#160;The portion allocable to
        warrants is accounted for as additional paid in capital, and the remaining
        portion is classified as debt.&#160;&#160;The fair value of the warrants issued
        to ComVest is being treated as debt discount, which will be accreted as interest
        expense utilizing the interest method over the 60-month term of the Term
        Loan.&#160;&#160;The assumptions used for the Black-Scholes option pricing model
        were as follows:&#160;&#160;risk-free interest rate of 4.66%, expected
        volatility of 123%, an expected life of five years, and no expected
        dividends.&#160;&#160;A summary of such follows:</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div>&#160;</div>

          </div>

      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">As
        of June
        30, 2007, the Company was in compliance with all terms and conditions of
        the
        Revolving Credit and Term Loan Agreement.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">There
        was
        no outstanding debt as of June 30, 2006.&#160;&#160;As of June 30, 2007, debt
        consisted of the following:</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div align="center">
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="80%">

            <tr>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="88%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>June
                  30</strong></font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" colspan="2" valign="bottom" width="10%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">

              </td>

            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="88%">

                  Term Loan, net of debt discount</font></div>
              </td>

              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="88%">

                  Million Revolving Senior Credit Facility</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>

              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="88%">

              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="88%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">Nystrom
                  subordinated note
                  payable</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;"><sup>&#160;</sup></font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">(b)</font></font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">-</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td valign="bottom" width="88%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>

                <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">6,359,074</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>

              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="88%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">

                  current portion</font></div>
              </td>

                  long-term debt</strong></font></div>
              </td>

              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">5,822,347</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">

            <tr valign="top">
              <td style="WIDTH: 72pt">
              </td>
              <td align="left" style="WIDTH: 18pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">(a)</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left">
                <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">This
                  Revolving Senior Credit Facility was replaced in April 2007 with
                  an $<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">8 million Senior
                  Credit Facility
                  to facilitate the acquisition of QR Srl.&#160;&#160;The $2.5 million
                  Revolving Credit Facility was due to expire in September 2007 and
                  was
                  repaid in full prior to the closing of the new $8 million Senior
                  Credit
                  Facility.</font></font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">

            <tr valign="top">
              <td style="WIDTH: 72pt">
              </td>
              <td align="left" style="WIDTH: 18pt">
                <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">(b)</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left">
                <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">This
                  note payable consisted of an $800,000 promissory note to ACG
                  Nystromgruppen AB ("Nystrom"), the former parent of a Swedish dental
                  company.&#160;&#160;Under the terms of this note, as amended, interest
                  only was paid quarterly for the first three years, followed by
                  36 equal
                  monthly installments of $22,222 plus interest on the unpaid balance,
                  which
                  began in May 2003.&#160;&#160;The Nystrom promissory note had an interest
                  rate reset annually based on the LIBOR plus 2%.&#160;&#160;This note was
                  repaid in full as of April 2006.</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

        June
        30, 2007, there was no foreign debt outstanding.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

        of long-term debt, including the Term loan, net of debt discount, and the
        Revolving Loan for the subsequent five years are as follows:</font></div>
