              <td valign="bottom" width="46%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="15%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">7,424,714</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="15%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">1,065,640</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="15%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">6,359,074</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">At
        June
        30, 2007, the Company had available $575,286 of unused lines of credit under
        the
        Revolving Senior Credit Facility.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Due
        to the
        short-term nature of all of the debt as well as borrowing rates currently
        available to the Company, the fair market value of all of the Company's debt
        approximated its carrying value.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div>
        <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

            <tr valign="top">
              <td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>5.</strong></font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>ACCRUED
                  EXPENSES:</strong></font></div>
              </td>

        </table>

        expenses consisted of the following</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif;">:</font></font></div>

              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>

                <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">1,565,174</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Included
        in accrued payroll expenses above is approximately $273,000 of severance
        indemnity costs mandated under Italian labor laws.&#160;&#160;All employees are
        entitled to an indemnity upon termination of their employment relationship
        for
        any reason.&#160;&#160;The respective benefit accrues to each employee on a
        pro-rata basis during their employment period and is based upon their respective
        salary.&#160;&#160;The vested benefit payable accrues interest.&#160;&#160;The
        amounts reflected in the consolidated balance sheets reflects the total amount
        of the indemnities that each employee would be entitled to receive if
        termination were to occur as of June 30, 2007.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div>
        <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

            <tr valign="top">
              <td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>6.</strong></font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>COMMON
                  STOCK OPTIONS:</strong></font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        Company has two employee incentive stock option plans under which approximately
        1,100,000 shares of Company common stock were originally authorized and
        available for issuance.&#160;&#160;Most options that are granted under the plans
        are fully vested when granted.&#160;&#160;Under the terms of these plans,
        options to purchase common stock of the Company may be granted at not less
        than
        85% of the fair market value of the stock on the date of grant, 100% of the
        fair
        market value in the case of incentive stock options qualifying under Section
        422A of the Internal Revenue Code (&#8220;ISOs&#8221;), or 110% of the fair market value of
        ISOs granted to persons owning more than 10% of the outstanding stock of
        the
        Company.&#160;&#160;As of June 30, 2007, all but 25,000 of the outstanding stock
        options issued by the Company were fully vested.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">As
        described in Note 1, effective July 1, 2005, the Company adopted the fair
        value
        based method of accounting for stock-based employee compensation under the
        provisions of Statement of Financial Accounting Standards No. 123 (Revised
        2004), <em>Share</em><em>Based Payment</em> (&#8220;SFAS No. 123R&#8221;), using the
        modified prospective method without restatement of the periods prior to the
        adoption date.&#160;&#160;As a result, the Company has begun recognizing expense
        in an amount equal to the fair value of share-based payments (including stock
        option awards) on their date of grant, over the vesting period of the
        awards.&#160;&#160;Under SFAS 123R, the Company must recognize compensation
        expense for (1) all share-based payments granted on or after July 1, 2005
        and
        (2) any partially vested options as of July 1, 2005.&#160;&#160;Prior to the
        adoption of SFAS 123R, the Company accounted for these plans pursuant to
        Accounting Principles Board Opinion No. 25 <em>Accounting for Stock Issued to
        Employees</em>.&#160;&#160;Therefore, compensation expense related to stock
        option awards was not reflected in operating expenses in any period prior
        to
        July 2005 (first quarter of Fiscal Year 2006), and prior period results have
        not
        been restated.&#160;&#160;See Note 1, for the effect on the Company&#8217;s net income
        and net income per share amount for the year ended June 30, 2005 had Stock
        Option Expense been determined in accordance with FAS 123.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        fair
        value of each option granted under the Company&#8217;s incentive stock plans during
        the twelve months ended June 30, 2007, 2006 and 2005 was estimated on the
        date
        of grant using the Black-Scholes option pricing method.&#160;&#160;Using this
        model, fair value is calculated based on assumptions with respect to (a)
        expected volatility of the market price of Company common stock, (b) the
        periods
        of time over which employees, directors and other option holders are expected
        to
        hold their options prior to exercise (expected lives), (c) expected dividend
        yield on Company common stock and (d) risk free interest rates which are
        based
        on quoted US Treasury rates for securities with maturities approximating
        the
        options&#8217; expected lives.&#160;&#160;Expected volatility has been estimated based
        on actual movements in the Company&#8217;s stock price over the most recent historical
        periods equivalent to the options&#8217; expected lives.&#160;&#160;Expected lives are
        principally based on the Company&#8217;s limited historical exercise experience with
        option grants with similar prices.&#160;&#160;The expected dividend yield is
        zero as the Company has never paid dividends and does not currently anticipate
        paying any dividends in the foreseeable future.&#160;&#160;The following table
        summarizes the weighted average values of the assumptions used in computing
        the
        fair value of option grants during the twelve months ended June 30, 2007,
        2006
        and 2005.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div align="center">
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="80%">

            <tr>
              <td align="justify" valign="top" width="26%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">.</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="15%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">2007</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="14%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">2006</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="15%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">2005</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td align="justify" valign="top" width="26%">

                  volatility</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="15%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">148%
                  - 151%</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="14%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">151%
                  - 155%</font></div>
              </td>

              </td>
            </tr>

              <td align="justify" valign="top" width="26%">

                  lives from grant date</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="15%">

              </td>

              </td>

              </td>

                  - 5.13%</font></div>
              </td>

      </div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Stock
        options to purchase an aggregate 20,000 shares of Company common stock were
        granted to the Company&#8217;s outside Board of Director members in the three-month
        period ended September 30, 2006.&#160;&#160;The outside Board of Director
        members elected to forgo the issuance of an additional 20,000 shares of common
        stock, to which they were entitled, in accordance with the Company&#8217;s policy for
        non-employee director compensation<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">.&#160;&#160;</font>Stock options to
        purchase an aggregate of 50,000 shares of Company common stock were granted
        to
        an employee in April 2007, half of these options vested immediately and the
        remainder will vest in April 2008.&#160;&#160;Compensation expense amounting to
        $40,131 will be recognized in Fiscal Year 2008, upon the vesting of these
        options.</font></div>

      <div>
        <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

            <tr valign="top">
              <td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>7.</strong></font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>INCOME
                  TAXES:</strong></font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Income
        taxes are accounted for under the asset and liability
        method.&#160;&#160;Deferred income taxes are recorded for temporary differences
        between financial statement carrying amounts and the tax basis of assets
        and
        liabilities.&#160;&#160;Deferred tax assets reflect the tax rates expected to be
        in effect in the period in which the differences are expected to
        reverse.&#160;&#160;The Company records a valuation allowance to reduce its
        deferred tax asset to an amount that is more likely than not to be
        realized.&#160;&#160;As of June 30, 2007, the Company has recorded a deferred
        tax asset of approximately $1,296,000, which primarily relates to US losses
        recorded in prior years and foreign deferred tax assets acquired related
        to the
        acquisition of QR in April 2007.&#160;&#160;The Company believes that it is
        likely that the Company will utilize these prior year net operating loss
        carry
        forwards.&#160;&#160;However, should circumstance change and the Company
        determine that it will not be able to utilize its net operating loss
        carryforward, such as a decline in future consolidated taxable income, the
        Company will reevaluate its valuation allowance.&#160;&#160;The net tax expense
        recorded as of June 30, 2007 includes foreign taxes at the statutory rates
        on
        the Company&#8217;s foreign operations, deferred foreign taxes related to permanent
        tax items, and state income and capital taxes generated in the United
        States.</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">Net
        operating loss carryforwards
        ("NOLs") amounting to approximately $7.24 million&#160;in federal NOLs and $12.0
        million in state NOLs at June 30, 2007, will expire beginning in
        2010.&#160;&#160;The NOLs are subject to review by the Internal Revenue
        Service.&#160;&#160;Changes in ownership of the Company, as defined by Section
        382 of the Internal Revenue Code, will limit the amount of NOLs available
        for
        use in any one year.&#160;&#160;In assessing the realizability of deferred tax
        assets, management considers whether it is more likely than not that some
        portion of the deferred tax assets will not be realized.&#160;&#160;The ultimate
        realization of deferred tax assets is based upon the generation of future
        taxable income during future periods. </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman, serif;">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">The
        Company recorded the above valuation
        reserve, based on management's conclusion that it is more likely than not
        that
        consolidated future operations will not generate sufficient taxable income
        to
        realize the entire deferred tax assets during the carryforward period for
        these
        tax attributes</font></font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>

        income/(loss) before provision for income taxes is comprised of the
        following:</font></div>

      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        difference between the provision for income taxes at the effective federal
        statutory rates and the amounts provided in the consolidated financial
        statements is summarized as follows:</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div align="center">
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="80%">

            <tr>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="32%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">June
                  30,</font></div>
              </td>

                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">-</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td align="left" valign="top" width="43%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">Deferred
                  tax asset - Total</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="14%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$1,295,718</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="14%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;680,000</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">F-15</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div>
        <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

            <tr valign="top">
              <td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">8.</font></strong></font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">PROFIT
                  SHARING
                  PLAN</font>:</strong></font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        Company maintains a defined contribution profit-sharing plan and trust pursuant
        to which its United States participants receive certain benefits upon
        retirement, death, disability and, to a limited extent, upon termination
        of
        employment for other reasons.&#160;&#160;In fiscal 2006, the Company established
        a Safe Harbor 401(k) defined contribution plan pursuant to which all eligible
        participants can make contributions.&#160;&#160;In addition, the Company is
        required to make either a specified matching contribution or a 3% contribution
        to all participants.&#160;&#160;Allocation among participants' interests,
        including officers and directors who are employees, is in accordance with
        IRS
        regulations for both of these plans.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        aggregate amount contributed to each of these plans by the Company each fiscal
        year is determined by the board of directors following a review of the profits
        of such fiscal year.&#160;&#160;For the years ended June 30, 2007 and 2006, the
        Company contributed $143,112 and $126,716, respectively towards the Safe
        Harbor
        401(k).&#160;&#160;The profit sharing plan requires no minimum contribution by
        the Company.&#160;&#160;The Company made a contribution of $63,550 for the year
        ended June 30, 2005 towards the profit sharing plan.&#160;&#160;In Fiscal Year
        2008, the Company plans to distribute the cash and short-term marketable
        securities contained within the profit sharing plan to each employee&#8217;s
        respective 401(k) account, based on their respective pro-rata
        balances.&#160;&#160;The profit sharing plan will only contain its existing
        common stock portfolio and the Company does not intend to make any further
        contributions to this plan.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div>
        <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

            <tr valign="top">
              <td style="WIDTH: 27pt">
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">9.</font></strong></font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">COMMITMENTS
                  AND
                  CONTINGENCIES</font>:</strong></font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        Company is a defendant in an environmental claim relating to a property in
        New
        Jersey owned by the Company between August 1984 and June 1985.&#160;&#160;This
        claim relates to the offsite commercial disposition of trash and waste in
        a
        landfill in New Jersey.&#160;&#160;The Company maintains that its waste
        materials were of a general commercial nature. This claim was originally
        filed
        in 1998 by the federal government in United States District Court and the
        State
        of New Jersey, citing several hundred other third-party
        defendants.&#160;&#160;The Company (through its former subsidiary, Kenro
        Corporation) was added, along with many other defendants, to the
        suit.&#160;&#160;The Company's claimed liability was potentially assessed by the
        plaintiff at $150,000.&#160;&#160;The Company has joined, along with other
        involved defendants in an alternative dispute resolution (ADR) process for
        smaller claims.&#160;&#160;A recent settlement amount was offered by this group,
        however, to date, no settlement has been reached.&#160;&#160;The potential cost
        to the Company based on this settlement offer has been assessed at
        $18,080.&#160;&#160;The Company had accrued $11,550 as of Fiscal Year 2007 and
        Fiscal Year 2006, which represents the Company&#8217;s estimate of its potential
        liability, net of the Company&#8217;s insurance carrier&#8217;s agreed-upon contribution
        towards a potential settlement.&#160;&#160;The Company does not expect to
        receive any further information until a status conference is held in late
        November 2007.&#160;&#160;The Company cannot, at this time, assess the amount of
        liability that could result from any adverse final outcome of this environmental
        complaint. The Company's insurance carrier has agreed to equally share with
        the
        Company the defense costs incurred in this environmental claim.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">On
        February 8, 2005, the Company finalized a settlement relating to a separate
        environmental claim filed in 2001 as a civil complaint brought by the current
        owners of the same property owned by the Company between August 1984 and
        June
        1985.&#160;&#160;This action was filed in the Superior Court of New Jersey,
        Morris County, and alleged that the Company&#8217;s discontinued graphic art camera
        subsidiary had contaminated a portion of the site during its manufacturing
        process prior to 1985.&#160;&#160;The settlement included a release and
        indemnification as well as a stipulation of dismissal with
        prejudice.&#160;&#160;The Company paid $325,000 on February 18, 2005, which
        represented the Company&#8217;s entire liability under the settlement agreement, net
        of the Company&#8217;s insurance carrier&#8217;s contribution towards the total and final
        settlement.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">On
        October
        1, 2007, a settlement was reached in the product liability insurance action
        filed in May 2005 in the Superior Court in Hartford, Connecticut and later
        transferred to the United States District Court, District of Connecticut,
        in
        which the Company was a defendant (with several other parties).&#160;&#160;The
        plaintiff, through its insurance company, claimed that the Company&#8217;s equipment
        caused damages on the plaintiff&#8217;s premises in May 2003.&#160;&#160;The case was
        settled for less than the originally claimed amount and included mutual releases
        for all participating parties from any liability arising from the
        claim.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s insurance carrier was responsible for the
        settlement, and therefore there was no financial effect on the
        Company.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        Company is involved in two other product liability insurance actions, however,
        to date, no lawsuits have been filed.&#160;&#160;The Company maintains that its
        equipment was not the cause of the respective incidents or the resultant
        damage.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s insurance carriers, and their attorneys, are
        assisting in the Company&#8217;s defense in these matters.&#160;&#160;The Company does
        not believe that the final outcome of either of these matters will have a
        material adverse effect on the Company.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        Company was named as a third party defendant in a lawsuit which was filed
        in May
        2007 in the Supreme Court of Orange County, New York.&#160;&#160;The lawsuit
        alleges that the Company&#8217;s negligence in manufacturing, designing, assembling
        and distributing its digital radiographic sensors caused damages to the
        plaintiff.&#160;&#160;The entire complaint seeks $37,770 in
        damages.&#160;&#160;The Company believes its obligation is limited to less than
        $10,000, based on the specifics of the transaction.&#160;&#160;The Company has
        offered a full refund on this transaction and is awaiting the
        plaintiff&#160;&#160;and defendant to resolve their specific
        differences.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s attorneys, are assisting in the Company&#8217;s
        defense in this matter and are trying to finalize a mutually acceptable
        settlement with all concerned parties.&#160;&#160;The Company does not believe
        that the final outcome of this matter will have a material adverse effect
        on the
        Company.</font></div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">F-16</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">On
        August
        8, 2007, the Company received a letter from Lightyear Technology&#8217;s counsel that
        alleges certain actions the Company may have taken in subsequent to the
        acquisition of a distribution channel, in December 2006.&#160;&#160;The claims
        may give rise to causes of action and claims of fraud and breach of
        contract.&#160;&#160;To date, no legal action has been filed.&#160;&#160;The
        Company is currently in full compliance with the terms of the contract and
        maintains that there was neither fraud, nor breach of contract.&#160;&#160;The
        Company acted in good faith at all times with the management and direction
        of
        this distribution channel.&#160;&#160;At this time, the Company cannot access
        the final outcome of this situation.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">From
        time
        to time, the Company may be party to other claims and litigation arising
        in the
        ordinary course of business.&#160;&#160;The Company does not believe that any
        adverse final outcome of any of these matters, whether covered by insurance
        or
        otherwise, would have a material adverse effect on the Company.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        Company has a noncancelable operating lease, as amended in March 2004, for
        office and manufacturing facilities in Elmsford, New York which expires in
        fiscal year 2010.&#160;&#160;The lease provides for rent abatements and
        scheduled increases in base rent.&#160;&#160;Rent expense is charged to
        operations ratably over the term of the lease resulting in deferred rent
        payable, which represents cumulative rent expense charged to operations from
        inception of this lease in excess of required lease payments. Rent expense
        was
        approximately $508,000 for each of the years ended June 30, 2007, 2006 and
        2005,
        re<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">spectively.</font></font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        Company has a noncancelable operating lease for office and manufacturing
        facilities in Verona, Italy which expires in fiscal year 2015, which it assumed
        in April 2007 with the acquisition of QR srl.&#160;&#160;Rent expense is
        approximately $112,000 per year using the average exchange rate for the 12
        months ended June 30, 2007.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">As
        part of
        the acquisition of QR srl, the Company granted employment agreements to each
        of
        the four former owners, for a total yearly commitment of 500,000
        Euros.&#160;&#160;Each agreement is for a period of five years and contains a
        non-compete clause.&#160;&#160;The Company can terminate each agreement after
        the first year of employment, in which event, any employee so terminated
        is
        entitled to one-half of the salary for the remaining term.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        Company has a noncancelable operating lease for its small sales and marketing
        facility in Roswell, Georgia, which expires in fiscal year 2009.&#160;&#160;The
        Company assumed this lease in December 2007, and rent expense was approximately
        $95,600 in fiscal year 2007.&#160;&#160;The Company sub-lets a portion of this
        facility to an unrelated third-party.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Minimum
        annual rental payments under these leases are as follows:</font></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div align="center">
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="70%">

            <tr>
              <td align="justify" valign="top" width="34%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">Year
                  ending June 30,</font></div>
              </td>
              <td valign="top" width="19%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td align="justify" valign="top" width="34%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;2008</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="19%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;805,731</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td align="justify" valign="top" width="34%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;2009</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="19%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">795,554</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td align="justify" valign="top" width="34%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;2010</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="19%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">374,975</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td align="justify" valign="top" width="34%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;2011</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="19%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">112,432</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td align="justify" valign="top" width="34%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;2012
                  and thereafter</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="19%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">449,729</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td valign="top" width="34%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="19%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$2,538,423</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        Company&#8217;s Italian subsidiary has the ability to borrow up to 350,000 Euros under
        two separate lines of credit and up to an additional one million Euros from
        three different lines, all guaranteed by its accounts receivables and
        inventory.&#160;&#160;All the lines are with two different financial
        institutions.&#160;&#160;These lines of credit were granted in August 2007, and
        no funds were outstanding as of June 30, 2007.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div>
        <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

            <tr valign="top">
              <td style="WIDTH: 36pt">
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">10.</font></strong></font></div>
              </td>
              <td>
                <div align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">SEGMENT
                  INFORMATION</font>:</strong></font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">As
        of June
        30, 2007 and 2006, the Company had only one business segment, medical/dental
        imaging.&#160;&#160;The medical/dental segment operations are conducted under
        the Dent-X, EVA, NewTom and AFP trade names and consist of the design,
        development, manufacturing, marketing and distribution of medical and dental
        imaging systems and all related accessories.&#160;&#160;The amortization of the
        intangibles and the write-off of the in-process research and development
        associated with the acquisition of QR has been attributed to the Italian
        operations.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">F-17</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div align="center">
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="90%">

            <tr>
              <td align="left" colspan="12" valign="bottom" width="99%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">Geographical
                  financial information for the years ended June 30, 2007, 2006 and
                  2005 is
                  as follows:</font></div>

              </td>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">During
        the
        years ended June 30, 2007, 2006 and 2005, no one customer aggregated over
        10% of
        consolidated net sales.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>11.&#160;&#160;GOODWILL
        AND OTHER INTANGIBLES</strong></font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">On
        April
        19, 2007 the Company acquired through its wholly-owned subsidiary QR Imaging
        srl, QR srl, (&#8220;QR&#8221;) an Italian corporation, located in Verona,
        Italy.&#160;&#160;The purchase price was 13 million Euros and was funded through
        the issuance of stock and assumption of new debt.&#160;&#160;The company
        incurred approximately $1,558,000 of transactions costs, for a total purchase
        price of $18,875,360. The Company granted employment agreements to each of
        the
        four former owners as part of the transaction.&#160;&#160;QR is a global
        supplier of three-dimensional dental computed tomography.&#160;&#160;The results
        of QR&#8217;s operations have been combined with those of the Company since the date
        of acquisition.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        acquisition was accounted for under the purchase method of accounting in
        accordance with FASB Statement No. 141, Business Combinations (&#8220;SFAS
        141&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The carrying values of QR&#8217;s assets and liabilities were
        adjusted to their fair values on April 19, 2007 and the difference between
        the
        purchase price and the fair value of the net assets and liabilities was recorded
        as goodwill.&#160;&#160;The Company used an independent third-party valuation
        firm to assist in determining the fair value of the assets
        acquired.&#160;&#160;Many factors were considered including expected worldwide
        sales in the next several years, the existing customer base based on QR being
        a
        dominant supplier of three-dimensional dental imaging prior to the acquisition
        and the value of the in-process development of new products prior to the
        acquisition date.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        allocation of the purchase price is as follows:</font></div>
      <div><br></div>

                  assets</font></div>

                  Price</strong></font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="13%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$
                  18,875,400</font></div>

      </div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        Company believes that the acquisition will strengthen its competitive position
        in the technology-driven Imaging Systems marketplace by adding three-dimensional
        imaging to its core products as well as greatly expanding its product
        development capabilities and its world-wide presence.&#160;&#160;The acquisition
        is expected to provide certain synergies for both companies.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">F-18</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
            <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
      <div>&#160;</div>
      <div><font size="2">A summary of the identifiable intangible assets acquired
        is as
        follows:</font></div>
      <div align="center">
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="80%">

            <tr>
              <td valign="top" width="68%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="15%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center">&#160;</div>
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;"><strong>Fair
                  Value</strong></font></div>
              </td>
              <td width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="15%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                <div>&#160;</div>

              </td>
            </tr>

                  technologies</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="15%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">$5,320,000</font></div>
              </td>

              <td align="right" valign="top" width="15%">

              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="15%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">3,846,405</font></div>
              </td>
              <td width="2%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="top" width="15%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">indefinite</font></div>
              </td>
            </tr>

        </table>
      </div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        in
        process research and development (&#8220;IPR&amp;D&#8221;) primarily relates to the
        development of additional 3D imaging equipment.&#160;&#160;As of June 30, 2007,
        this equipment was not completely developed, nor certified for use, and was
        therefore classified as IPR&amp;D by the independent evaluation
        firm.&#160;&#160;No alternative future use was identified for these assets, and
        therefore the entire value was charged to the income statement, included
        in the
        write-off of in process research and development line item in Fiscal Year
        2007.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        useful
        lives of the technology assets was determined based on the expected use of
        the
        technology, any legal or contractual provisions that might limit the useful
        lives of the technology, and the effects of know advances, obsolescence,
        demand
        and competition required to maintain the future cash flows of the intangible
        assets.&#160;&#160;Based on these factors, developed technologies were assigned
        useful lives of 7 years.&#160;&#160;The useful life of customer relationships
        was based on the length of existing contractual dealer and customer
        relationships as well as the estimated average period of 10 years after which
        the customer or dealer would need to be retrained, similar to a new customer
        or
        dealer.&#160;&#160;The useful life of the non-compete contracts was based on
        contractual provisions of the acquisition agreement.&#160;&#160;The goodwill of
        $3,846,405 is expected to be deducted for tax purposes over fifteen
        years.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>

        following is a summary of the amortization of the intangible assets subject
        to
        amortization:</font></div>

      </div>

        expense related to intangible assets subject to amortization was $225,054
        for
        2007.</font></div>

        expense related to intangible assets subject to amortization for the next
        five
        years is as follows:</font></div>

      </div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">(A)
        Included in the fourth quarter of Fiscal Year 2007, is a charge for $3,760,000
        to write-off the in process research and development associated with the
        acquisition of QR in April 2007,</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
          </div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt;">F-20</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">

                    for doubtful accounts and sales</font></div>
                </td>

    <div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><u>Item
        9.&#160;&#160;Changes in and Disagreements with Accountants and Financial
        Disclosure</u></strong></font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">None</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><u>Item
        9A.&#160;&#160;Controls and Procedures</u></strong></font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">An
        evaluation was performed as of June 30, 2007, under the supervision and with
        the
        participation of the Company&#8217;s management, including its co-chief executive
        officers and chief financial officer, of the effectiveness of the design
        and
        operation of the Company&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures.&#160;&#160;Based
        on such evaluation, the Company&#8217;s management has concluded that the Company&#8217;s
        disclosure controls and procedures were effective as of June 30,
        2007.&#160;&#160;There have been no significant changes in our internal controls
        or in other factors that could significantly affect our internal control
        subsequent to June 30, 2007.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><u>Item
        9B.&#160;&#160;Other Information</u></strong></font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Not
        applicable.</font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><u>Part
        III</u></strong></font></div>
      <div><br></div>
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
        information required in items 10, 11, 12, 13, and 14 is hereby incorporated
        by
        reference from the Company&#8217;s definitive Proxy Statement for the 2007 Annual
        Meeting of Shareholders.</font></div>

                        of common
                        stock, effective May 2006. (17), (18)</font></div>

          <div align="left">
            <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">

                <tr>
                  <td align="left" valign="top" width="5%">

                      file
                      #2-G8980 of the Company, as amended, on file with the Securities

                      Exchange Commission.</font></div>

    <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Exhibit

    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong><u>CERTIFICATION</u></strong></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">&#160;I,
      David Vozick, Co-Principal Executive Officer of AFP Imaging Corporation, certify
      that:</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div>
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">1.&#160;&#160;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">I
                have reviewed this Annual Report on Form 10-K of AFP Imaging
                Corporation;</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">2.&#160;&#160;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Based
                on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement
                of a
                material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make
                the
                statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements
                were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this
                report;</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">3.&#160;&#160;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Based
                on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information
                included in this report, fairly present in all material respects
                the
                financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the
                registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this
                report;</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">4.&#160;&#160;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
                registrant&#8217;s other certifying officers and I are responsible for
                establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as
                defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) for the registrant
                and have:</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 49.5pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">a)</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">&#160;Designed
                such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure
                controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to
                ensure
                that material information relating to the registrant, including its
                consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those
                entities, particularly during the period in which this report is
                being
                prepared;</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 49.5pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">b)</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">&#160;Evaluated
                the effectiveness of the registrant&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures
                and presented in this report our conclusions about the effectiveness
                of
                the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the period
                covered by this report based on such evaluation;
                and</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 49.5pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">c)</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">&#160;Disclosed
                in this report any change in the registrant&#8217;s internal control over
                financial reporting that occurred during the registrant&#8217;s most recent
                fiscal quarter (the registrant&#8217;s fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an
                annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely
                to
                materially affect, the registrant&#8217;s internal control over financial
                reporting; and</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">5.&#160;&#160;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">The
                registrant&#8217;s other certifying officers and I have disclosed, based on our
                most recent evaluation of internal control over financial reporting,
                to
                the registrant&#8217;s auditors and the audit committee of the registrant&#8217;s
                board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent
                functions):</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 49.5pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">a)</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">&#160;All
                significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design or
                operation of internal control over financial reporting which are
                reasonably likely to adversely affect the registrant&#8217;s ability to record,
                process, summarize and report financial information:
                and</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div>
      <table align="center" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="hangingindent" width="100%">

          <tr valign="top">
            <td style="WIDTH: 49.5pt">
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">b)</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">&#160;Any
                fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other
                employees who have a significant role in the registrant&#8217;s internal
                controls over financial reporting.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>
    <div>&#160;</div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div>
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">

          <tr>
            <td align="left" valign="top" width="37%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">Date:
                October 12, 2007</font></div>
            </td>
            <td valign="top" width="37%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">___________/s/______________</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

            <td valign="top" width="37%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">&#160;</font></td>

              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman;">David

      Donald Rabinovitch Co-Principal Executive Officer of AFP Imaging Corporation,
      certify that:</font></div>
    <div><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">1.&#160;&#160;&#160;I
      have reviewed this Annual Report on Form 10-K of AFP Imaging

                the
                statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements
                were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this
                report;</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">Based
                on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information
                included in this report, fairly present in all material respects
                the
                financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the
                registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this

            </td>
          </tr>

            </td>
          </tr>

            </td>
            <td>
              <div align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;">&#160;Designed
                such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure
                controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to
                ensure
                that material information relating to the registrant, including its
                consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those
                entities, particularly during the period in which this report is
                being
                prepared;</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>

      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify">&#160;</div>

                of

                and</font></div>
            </td>

            </td>
            <td>

    <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman;"><strong>Exhibit
